Reviews.Title: “Great, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: SweetCarolineKY
Reviews.Content: Our friends recently got married & had their wedding at the Omni. Their wedding could not have been more elegant, and went off without a hitch. The food was absolutely fantastic, and the decor was stunning. Out of convenience, we decided to stay at the Omni for the long weekend. While our hotel room was nice, it was insanely small for $200/night. The bathroom was literally the size of a closet. So small that only one person could even be in there at a time. The one other aspect that did not sit well with us was that they put 1 random older couple on the same floor as the wedding party (including the soon-to-be groom & his family). This older couple proceeded to call hotel security numerous times, claiming that there were multiple parties going on (completely false accusation, but I do know the noise level was not exactly what I would call quiet.) Now, I have to question the hotel staff's judgement putting a random couple in a room on the same hall as 40 wedding guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Choice”
Reviews.Author: ln_spindler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an event at Lucas Oil Stadium, and was able to walk everyday. Rooms were clean and comfy, room service and restaurant had great hours. Food was not so great- so many other great places a stone's throw away. Very busy weekend and getting the car back from the Valet service was a bit frustrating, but everything else was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: MoJo82
Reviews.Content: At check-in the clerk acknowledged me as the "Expedia Rate guaranteed room"... Thought that was strange. Anyway, bell and desk staff were nice. The room was small but the Bathroom was tiny, most notably the sink area had no counter space whatsoever to place vanity items. It basically consisted of the sink top and no more. No place to hang towels either... just a little frustrating. Would only stay at this property again if I could upgrade to a suite. Looks like there are several other cute hotels in the immediate area if you want to stay downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great---room was average”
Reviews.Author: sonofMax
Reviews.Content: We arrived on time but our room had not been cleaned. The front desk staff was accomodating and stored our luggage and offered us free drinks at the bar while we waited. After about an hour, we went to our room which was supposed to be a deluxe King but looked like it had been carved out of a coat closet. The bathroom was about as long as the bathtub and barely as wide. There was little room to move around in the room as the bed took up almost all available space. The elevators were clearly overworked all weekend and we frequently had to wait over 10 minutes to get an elevator to go up or down. Because of private parties in the hotel, access to the stairwells from the main lobby was restricted so there was no alternative but to wait for the elevator to get to your room. The housekeeping, front desk, restaurant and bell staff were polite and well informed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: LC-WorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January on a non-Superbowl weekend for a trip to see some friends. Paid for suite upgrade at check-in. Receptionist was very pleasant. Had a great spacious room. Would recommend for leisure travelers. Like all Omnis, frequent Omni members get a free shoe shine and morning coffee - always was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Week”
Reviews.Author: TravelTB84
Reviews.Content: Passing through the area I stopped in Indianapolis for Super Bowl week. The staff members at the Omni Hotel were absolutely wonderful and service oriented. My room was clean and well appointed. I was able to get a free upgrade by just asking. The club sandwich from room service was excellent. I would stay here next time I'm in Indy. I would absolutely go back to this hotel and a sporting event in Indianapolis. Great job by the police and special event staff during a very hectic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Downtown Sporting Events”
Reviews.Author: sawtom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Omni the week of the Super Bowl. It was located in the heart of the Super Bowl Village. Location is great for any downtown sporting event. Hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. There is a Starbucks located in the hotel. Have stayed frequently at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pamcarreira
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel overnight last month for business and I loved it. The staff is friendly and helpful, the room was very beautiful, clean and quiet. The location is great, surrounded by restaurants, bars and shopping. It's also right in the heart of the sporting venues in town. This was my first visit to downtown Indianapolis and although it was a short stay, I loved every part of it. I can't wait to return and would definitely stay at the Omni Severin again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueLineFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend the Disney on Ice performance at Banker's Life Fieldhouse. The hotel is convienently located in downtown Indianapolis. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The room we stayed in was very clean and nicely furnished. The prices for the items in the mini-bar are outrageous, but it's your choice to partake or not! The pool area is nice and the staff was excellent. Everyone was smiling and we felt well taken care of. My only complaint is that there is no free wireless internet. The Omni charges $9.95 unless you are a gold or platinum member. I think $10 is excessive for internet service for one night. I made do with the 3G service for my iPhone (which worked out fine).

Reviews.Title: “They redeemed themselves...good customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1966_MI
Reviews.Content: Was in Indianapolis for work, and stayed at the Omni. Good location; connected to mall, and walking distance to great restaurants. Room was well appointed, although the bathroom was the size of a postage stamp. The sink area was no wider than my shoulders, and there was hardly any room for my toiletries. Nonetheless, I made it work. I had ordered room service and the order-taker said it would be about 30 minutes. An hour later, still no food. I called down, and they weren't sure what happened and apologized for the delay. They said they would expedite the order and there would be no charge. Within 10 minutes my order had arrived. The next morning, I received a hand-written note of apology for the inconvenience and mix-up. That is good customer service in my book. I would definitely return to the Omni, based on the positive customer experience I had a result of the room service snafu. Good job, Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tayawhat
Reviews.Content: I spent one night over the Christmas vacation at the Omni Severin. The room was wonderful - nicely furnished & the beds were incredibly comfortable. I joined friends at the lobby bar & the bartender was great. We also ventured into the cigar bar, but the smoke there was just too thick for us. We loved the idea, but would suggest better ventilation. We were able to walk to several restaurants/sites in the downtown Indianapolis area, including shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: beth s
Reviews.Content: We were in town from Tennessee for the Titans-Colts game. Everyone was so nice and thoughtful. When the people at the front desk saw my little boys they game them a welcome pack with coloring books, crayons, and little toys. The room was spotless and cozy. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. We planned to stay saturday and sunday night but at 6pm on Sunday my little boy fell and broke his tooth at the Centre City Mall. We had to cut our trip short so we could get home and our son could see a dentist first thing the next morning. We told the front desk why we were leaving-not expecting anything-and they didn't charge us for that night and sent someone up for our bags right away. Not to mention it was close to everything! We will be back for sure and hopefully have better luck.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous Charges and several gaffe's!”
Reviews.Author: LPruitt090807
Reviews.Content: We were in town to attend the Colts-Titans game, and to spend an extra night the night before the game. The tickets were a Christmas gift. The hotel is difficult to find...we had directions from both Mapquest and Google Maps, and still drove around for over an hour before we found it. Had to wait for nearly 30 minutes to be valet parked! A few glitches at the front desk. The woman insisted that we booked through Expedia. We did NOT. We booked through Omni's reservation service, even speaking with one of their agents concerning specific amenities that we were looking for. We had a good rate, and our reservation promised a free breakfast buffet and valet parking at $17/night. NEITHER of these issues were honored. We left for Lucas Oil at 11:45am for a 1:00pm game. The Colts WON, and we hung around for awhile, returning to our room at 5:30pm. Our room had NOT been serviced. I called the front desk, and they promised to send housekeeping. It took another hour to get our room serviced!! The water pressure in our room was terrible. It was virtually non-existent! The bathroom was tiny and very dated in appearance. I mean, come on.....no one has the u-pipes exposed in a nice hotel. As many other people have mentioned, our room was very difficult to regulate its temperature. Ours was very chilly. The system is very loud when it comes on, disrupting sleep. We, too, had problems with pixelating in the in-room movie that we rented. Didn't even think to mention it to the concierge! The morning that we left, I called down to get our car brought around. The valet service never answered the phone. My partner went down to the lobby to obtain a luggage rack, and had to ask about our car then. (The hotel would not permit us to bring our own luggage down, necessitating another tip for the kid pushing the cart!) ALSO, Omni Reservations told us that there was a sky bridge from the hotel to Lucas Stadium. Of course, there is not. When we spoke with our "cart-pusher" after check in, he told us that that was a problem that Omni is aware of and are trying to fix. We will come back to see our beloved Colts next year, but will stay at The Crowne Plaza, like was recommended to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: ChefDanT
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice sports weekend in Downtown Indy. The Omni was a great base for us as it was right in between Conseco Fieldhouse and Lucas Oil Stadium and only two blocks away from both. The staff at this hotel seemed genuinely happy to attend to any need. The only problem (If you could even call it one) we had was a long wait for the valet. But understandable because it was right after a Colts game and traffic is crazy. Otherwise everything else was perfect. The rooms have been recently renovated, the elevators move quickly and the skywalk connection is a big plus. The Omni Severin is our new first choice hotel whenever we decide to go to Indianapolis and it has everything to do with the level of service we received. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: anderjim
Reviews.Content: Maybe the staff were on their toes because the Superbowl was coming soon. Maybe not. Either way, we were pampered by the doormen and bar staff, which gave this hotel (in a town we wouldn't have chosen to visit if family weren't nearby) a feeling of luxury. If you like good beer, ask what they have in the cooler, as there were some gems that didn't make it on to the menu. Our room had 2 comfortable queen beds, and was spacious and well appointed. The coffee situation could use an upgrade, both in the room and downstairs, where you pay a lot to get mediocre stuff in a paper cup. (Frankly, it's not much better when you leave the hotel -- after 3 days, we finally found Henry's Coffee Bistro on Pennsylvania, thank goodness.) The location is as good as it gets in Indianapolis: walking distance to sports fields and arenas, expensive restaurants, Steak & Shake, a couple of brewpubs and an enormous (and ennormously-boring) shopping mall that is actually connected to the hotel. It's also a 1-minute walk from the train station, which is nice and creepy at night.

Reviews.Title: “WoW... don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: MarthaStewart2011
Reviews.Content: The Omni works with Indianapolis police department to bust prostitutes and johns, I had the misfortune of my room being next to a sting operation. Doors slamming, loud screaming as the busted in on the suspects. I asked for another room, none were available so i recieved a discount on my stay. I couldn't sleep, I had my 11 yr old and 6 year old girls with me...I woould think the hotel would not let such things go on there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as snazzy as it looks”
Reviews.Author: Achillea
Reviews.Content: This hotel aspires to be a premium property, and the lobby and hallways have that flavor. But there is less there than meets the eye. The beds are just so-so. The climate control in meeting rooms is terrible. The housekeeping and room maintenace are problematic. There was something gooey on the floor of my bathroom and a non-working electrical outlet. Neither was tended to, despite promises from the front desk. The next day I picked up the city magazine in the room and found a huge piece of gum stuck to the bottom. In addition, there are signs of wear, including badly stained grout in the sink and tub. I reported the smell of gas in the hallway. It turned out to be a chemical smell from a nearby factory, but no one got back to me to tell me. And when there was a mistake on my bill, instead of taking my word for the fact that my group had breakfast coupons (I had one to show them), I was made to stand at the desk while the clerk leafed through all the previous day's breakfast receipts. And then our group's master billing seemed to fall through--our credit cards were charged instead. This hotel needs a major managerial and physical upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jessberger1986
Reviews.Content: We actually just arrived home today and felt the need to write a review right away. The hotel was as good as I expected it to be. Our room was clean and pretty big. The location was ideal and probably the selling point. Since we were in te city for the colts game it was so convenient that it was only about a 10 minute walk..if that! The hotel has a special skywalks enterance connecting it the the circle centre mall and it was great during those windy days. All in all I would stay there again and again...just love Indy!!! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pro Coach O
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel in downtown Indianapolis. A couple long hairs in sink, but.. overall it's ok. Only thing is ,,, no bus parking on site... bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: smcgal02
Reviews.Content: The Omni was great. The location is excellent. We walked to Circle Center in just a few minutes. We traveled to Indianapolis for an event at Lucas Oil Stadium and it was only a block away which was very convenient. We walked back at night and always felt safe because of the short distance. The valets were wonderful. Very efficient. There was a wedding party leaving at the same time as we were checking out and they still had the car in a matter of minutes. The room was clean and simple. We found the toilet very short which seemed a little odd but it was completely functional and very clean. The staff was polite and able to quickly answer any questions we had. The only thing that frustrated me a little was the heating/cooling system. I am not sure if it is because it is older but when it kicks on it is very loud. I am not a light sleeper but woke up several times when it kicked on. I have no complaints about the actual system because our room was always at the temp we set but the noise was a bit loud. The minifridge is right next to the bed as well and everytime the compressor kicked on it was loud. I seriously considered unplugging it. These are very trivial complaints though and I wouldn't hold them against the hotel. They do provide ear plugs which I utilized. All in all I would stay here again and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJ1981
Reviews.Content: The Omni Severin in Indy is a really pretty hotel. It connects to the mall, and is within walking distance of many attractions. The restaurant is okay (but in my opinion not worth the price). They have great customer service, and a great lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCFTAK
Reviews.Content: Everything from start to finish was a fantastic experience. Valet was very quick and efficient. Check in took a just a minute and the staff was very accomodating and friendly. The lobby area and restaurants were very nice. Our room was fairly large with a comfortable king sized bed with very soft sheets and pillows. The room also had a large desk, large flat screen TV and our view was overlooking downtown and the stadium. Everything was exceptionally clean and appeared very new. We did not use the pool or fitness center. This hotel is in a great location downtown. It was just a block or two to the monument and mall areas. There are MANY restaurants to choose from within a five minute walk. The entertainment district is right outside the doors. The hotel is also connected to circle center by a skywalk.

Reviews.Title: “If the staff aren't all happy people, they're great fakers!”
Reviews.Author: jktNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Omni Severin for a 3-day symposium. Because we were paying ( I'm guessing) a group rate, I was expecting a lower level than what we actually got. The location, of course, is excellent, but since we were fairly tightly scheduled for most of our visit that was not of much use to us. However the hotel itself was exceedingly comfortable all around, from the welcoming public spaces to the very comfortable rooms. The beds can not be improved upon! We had a small electronic glitch with a pay-per-view movie ( had occasional lines running through it) , and the front desk immediately took it off the bill when we mentioned it. We also asked for a second luggage rack and it appeared almost immediately. We ordered room service multiple times, and it always came exactly when they said it would, food hot and fresh, with no mistakes at any point. The food was definitely way above average- I can't remember the last time I have wanted to remain in a hotel for so many meals! Lastly, not only was the place clean as a whistle ( public and private spaces)- I don't think I saw as much as a stray coffee cup in three days- , but the staff universally receives an A+ for attitude and competence. Without an exception they made everyone feel welcome and taken care of. If they're not all very happy people, they're great fakers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: hikerbepw
Reviews.Content: We visited Indy for or wedding aniversary and had an excellent time. We stayed at the Omni in downtown Indianapolis. The hotel was very clean (the lobby had an odd perfumy smell). The first night the room seemed rather warm, so we left a note for housekeeping and the A/C unit in our room was replaced that afternoon! Talk about service! The pool is small, but very clean and nice towls are provided. It is a bit pricey to eat there, but there are a ton of eateries of every level in very close proximity. Currently, Super Bowl Village is being contructed around the hotel, and work is being done on the weekends and well into the night...earplugs are provided, you will need them, but this is obviously a temporary situation.

Reviews.Title: “Just Nice”
Reviews.Author: NettieNight
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for the Colts vs Steelers game. The main reason we chose this hotel was the 5 Diamond rating and the close proximity to Lucas Oil stadium. This is a very nice, clean, and average hotel. I was less then impressed with the amenities which are almost non existent beyond the in room coffee and mini toiletries. The bathroom, while clean and fully equipped looked out dated and run down next to the super modern bedroom. I was also concerned about how loud it was to flush the commode. I could hear all the rooms flushing around us and I'm sure they could hear ours. The pool was also a bit of a let down being very small and old it didn't really fit in with the rest of the establishment, not to mention the odd schedule of locking it up they had. It said open until 10pm but we frequently found it locked at other times. The staff is with out a doubt the shinning star of this hotel. Very friendly and attentive with no nasty attitudes from the valet all the way too the maids and everyone in between. At this hotel you are paying for and will get a great location, a well trained staff, good room size, and nice furnishings and accessories which are all things that can make or break a visit but you won't find any extras. If I was able to get a better price point when staying here I would not hesitate to be a guest again, however for $350+ a night I would have rather walked the extra block, stayed at the Hilton and enjoyed a more well rounded hotel with some frills.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: brylo2Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday 9/24/11. Great location just a short walk from the Lucas Oil football stadium. Also close to various bars etc. Everyone we encountered was professional and courteous. It was a very clean and well appointed hotel as you would expect in this class of a hotel. Workout room was well equipped and they also have a pool...but no hot tub however. Has a nice lounge as well. We used the valet parking and had good service with that as well. Our son left a couple pillows behind that he likes to travel with...they were at our doorstep today...sent fed ex. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: TDK1009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never stayed at this hotel before in Indianapolis. We found this hotel, friendly clean, large bedroom, great big closet (nice if you were traveling for a period of time). The buffett breakfast was very delicious and look forward to staying there in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jobcoach
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel! Excellent staff, great rooms, and extremely well located in downtown Indianapolis! I wouldn't think twice about staying there again. The bed was very comfortable, there were plenty of towels in the bathroom, and the shower had excellent water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home (as sad as that might sound)”
Reviews.Author: flyindrivintryin
Reviews.Content: On average, I overnight in Indianapolis once a month and the Omni Severin is always my first hotel choice. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and readily willing to help (a trait that ironically seems increasingly absent in the service industry). The lobby, hallways and rooms are always clean. The hotel restaurant's dinner offering is supperb. Good enough, too, that I don't mind ordering room service on those nights when I have to work in my room. The breakfast is good but standard fare, but then I'm not a big fan of breakfast anyway so the granola and yogurt suffices for me. The only drawback of this hotel is the funk that emminates from Olives, the cigar lounge/bar off the lobby. The gift shop, whose back wall is the opposite side of the bar's wall, often reeks of stale stogie. If you need anything from the gift shop (and are not a cigar fan), get in, get what you need, and get out. But then, who hangs out in hotel gift shops for long anyway. The hotel location is great, walking distance to many great restaurants and shops. It is connected to a shopping mall via a covered walkway on the mezzanine. I have been an Omni Select Guest member for a decade so granted that drives the upgrades I am routinely provided, but I keep going back to this hotel simply because it is such a great place to stay. But, I initially joined the Select Guest program of this hotel for the very reason that I knew it would be my first preference on all return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly service.... loud airco”
Reviews.Author: MarcMich
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Indy Omni Severin. Overall this was a positive experience: while rooms are relatively small for US standards (not sure about my floor anymore, it was 1 below top floor, I think it was 18 ot 19th), all is there. You even get in this small room, a 42 inch flat screen so you might consider bringing along a media player. Also very good was the bed: big king size bed with all needed pillows and good boxspring. All of this could have been spoiled by the overly loud airco (and it really was way too hot outside to stop the airco), if I wouldn't have brought my traveler emergency kit including earplugs :-) People at reception were very helpful, restaurant was fair quality for money with friendly waiters. Breakfast had a bigger, and higher quality choice than other hotels I stayed at in indy. Shuttle busses were available every 15 min from 7AM on, so very convenient. And of course, being in the city centre, connected to the Circle Mall, allows you to walk around in an airconditioned environment almost up to any address downtown. I'll certainly go back to the Omni... just hope they'll fix those loud airco's.

Reviews.Title: “We Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lola1960048
Reviews.Content: We travel several times a year and this hotel is always one of our favorites. It's attached to the City Center Mall and the convention center so its convenient when the weather is bad. The staff is always pleasant and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING Stay. Lives up to the Omni name!”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: Okay, first a few things out of the way.... I am not a hotel employee. I am a real business and pleasure traveler just like you who has had the opportunity to stay at many hotels over the course of a year. Check my other reviews on TripAdvisor. I do a rather good job of telling things as they are. When I stay at a hotel, I usually pick one that falls in the mid-price range. You know, the hotels that give you the best bang for the buck. For years my favorite hotel brand was Marriott. Can't beat their hotels. However, since doing more business conventions, I have found myself staying at Omni hotels. First, the one in Atlanta and now Indianapolis. Quite frankly, if you are not here on business, I can't for the life of me think why anyone would come to Indianapolis. It's a nice city. Very clean. Nothing to see or do except perhaps the zoo or a football game. On my free day, I walked around the entire day and found nothing overly exciting here. There are, however, very good restaurants close to the hotel. Oh, back to the hotel.... They say the first impression is a lasting one. From the moment I arrived, I felt I was being treated like a VIP. I stepped out of the town car (Carey Indiana - EXCELLENT) and there were several bellboys at the door entrance eager to assist and open the door for me. I walk in, and there is a very lovely woman bidding me "Good Morning." I get to the desk, and though I am several hours early, I am quickly checked in and handed a room key. Since I was here on business, I booked three rooms for myself and my partners. They were all under my name, yet the hotel desk was very good about assigning the rooms to my partners and making certain that we were located together. My room was on the 11th floor, 1110. It was practically next to the elevator. Complaints have run amok here that the rooms in this Omni are small. I suspect so, due to the fact that this a hotel that was converted from something else. However, if you book a room with double beds (instead of a King) you are getting a larger room, essentially going from 180 to 244 square feet. So, the double bed room that I had didn't especially seem tiny at all. Perhaps the bathroom is smaller than I have seen elsewhere, but I made perfectly do with the space I had available. The room was very clean. Lots of closet space, an iron and electronic safe in the room. The television was a Panasonic flat screen HD. I don't know what signal the hotel is getting, but the picture pixelated often even though the weather was fine. They really need to do something about their TV signal. One thing everyone must do is join their rewards program. It is free by going to the Omni website. It allows you free WiFi and complimentary beverage in the morning delivered to your room. I am guessing I am at the second-tier GOLD status. I love the fact that before I go to sleep I fill out a little form requesting a carafe of coffee, juice or water to be sent to my room and when I wake up, there is a little tray outside my door along with a newspaper. All that is totally complimentary just because I am a rewards member. I think, even at the bottom rung of the program, you get all those amenities. Certainly something more than I get from something like the Marriott. Bed was very comfortable. Lots of pillows. A plug next to it to charge my iPhone. A desk with plug outlets. Very, very nice indeed. If I have ONE complaint it's the loud air-conditioning in the room. It turns on and off according to the thermostat settings. Of course, many of us like a cold room to snuggle beneath the covers with. The thermostat goes to 60 degrees. However, every time the air conditioning comes on, it makes a loud, grinding noise that makes sleeping impossible. So, I pretty much had to turn the air conditioner off at night. If hotel management is reading this (and I am certain they are), I am hoping you can fix the air conditioner noise in that room by the time I return next year. Another problem (not the fault of the hotel) is the noise from the street below. My window was facing the Claddagh Irish Pub. On the weekends, it is a noisy hotspot. Now, on the 11th floor it really didn't bother me. However, I feel sorry for those on the lower floors. There is no escaping that noise. And really, there is no escaping street noise as the hotel is surrounded by nightlife activity practically on all sides. If I can sneak one more problem in the mix it would be the elevators. There are only two that I know of off of the lobby. They are small. They are rather slow. During conventions (and remember, there are conventions here almost weekly) those elevators turn into local cars that stop at every floor and get crowded rather quickly. We were fortunate enough to snag the breakfast package for our stay. Usually breakfast costs $17 for the buffet, we got it at an extra room rate of $10 per night. Totally worth it. Nice selection of fruits, yogurts, breads, cereals, eggs, sausage and bacon, french toast or pancakes (alternates by day) and an omelet station where a cook makes them fresh for you. My favorite was the biscuits and gravy that were available every morning. If you don't get the breakfast package and want to eat cheaper, you don't have to walk far to find an eatery. Back to the hotel.... On my final morning, I had shared car service waiting with Carey Indiana. I am standing outside of the hotel with my luggage at 5:40am. The bellboy was extremely helpful in making certain that I got to my town care as generally, they can drive up to any one of two locations at the hotel. He went out of his way to look for the car and alert the driver of my presence. It was another one of those special moments where I felt like, "Wow, they really are attentive to people's needs here." So, as you probably have gathered by now, I highly recommend this hotel. Yeah, I have read a few of the negative reviews posted on TripAdvisor -- and I am certain they are legitimate complaints -- but I would have to side with many more that are giving the highest accolades to this hotel and their service. From the moment you arrive, the staff goes out of their way to open doors for you and make you feel welcome. I look forward to returning next September. For dinner we thoroughly enjoyed Harry & Izzy's, a few feet from the hotel, which has an excellent variety of food at reasonable prices and casual attire. We also ate at the Brazilian Steakhouse, Fogo de Chao, which is a 5-minute walk. If you have never tried a Brazilian Steakhouse, this is the world's most renowned chain. We even enjoyed milkshakes at Steak & Shake across the street. Damn good -- eat with a spoon -- you get a very large glass topped with whip cream and a cherry for $3.95. Tremendous bargain, and really, I was surprised how good they were. The Circle Center Mall is connected by a skyway. To be honest, nothing really special about this mall. Not even an Apple store inside. The mall was mostly dead, and nothing really caught my eye about it. Of course, all the hotels in the area connect to the Indianapolis Convention Center by a sky walkway. However, taking that walkway from the Omni to the Convention Center will waste 12 minutes of your life. A horribly, long haul that takes you through the mall and beside a parking garage. However, you can get to the convention center in 4 minutes if you simply walk outside and across South Illinois and South Capitol streets.

Reviews.Title: “A first-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodWallah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is obviously managed well and is spotlessly clean. It is physically nice but not exceptional. The service was outstanding: The staff were helpful and professional -- special kudos to Christy at the front desk who was knowledgeable, professional, and offered excellent recommendations about restaurants, shops and so on. One suggestion about the guest rooms: The bathrooms are small and have VERY little counter space for shaving kits, makeup bags, hair dryer, etc. It would be easy and SO useful to have a few small glass or plexiglass shelves on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: The room was so small, not enought outlets to do hair. Bathroom was dirty when we arrived(dirt and hair on the floor behind the door and toilet had not been cleaned under the seat), no exhaust fans. Fire alarms went off three times starting at 11:00 at night! We were on the 7th floor and evacuated by way of stairs because that is what the intercom said to do. When we got to the first floor we were told it was a prank and for us to walk back up to our room(That is 14 flights of stairs i had to climb and I am 52!!!)! We told of our disapointment to the consierge and desk clerk who did not show any concern or seem to care, just stated that it is a Historic Hotel. For the price I paid, I was extremely dissatisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ALJARN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a nice weekend getaway in downtown Indy in August. First, the location of the hotel is great. It is connected by the skywalk to Circle Centre Mall, the convention center and several other hotels. There are multiple good restaurants within easy walking distance. Lucas Oil Stadium is also very close. Lots of options for things to do are nearby. We opted to use valet parking. Price is $27/day with unlimited in/out privileges. There apparently is a self parking garage nearby that costs nearly as much without in/out privileges, so we used valet. Only left via car once and car was waiting for us when we got downstairs from our room. Our check in went without problems. Front desk staff was cordial and efficient. We were in our room within 15 minutes of walking in the front door. We had a two room suite. Room was a nice size. Living room area had a sofa sleeper, chairs, desk, nice size flat screen as well as a bar and in room snacks. Bedroom was a separate room with french doors between the two rooms. This room was also a nice size with a big screen TV. Bed linens were mostly comfortable-four king sized pillows provided. (See below.) Bathroom was more along the lines of a Holiday Inn bathroom...okay but not great. There were more bath amenities than Holiday Inn, though. We had a "romance" package for our reservation which included sparkling wine, truffles and breakfast (included "valentinis.") The sparkling wine and truffles were okay, not great. Breakfast at Severin Bar was very good with an omelet bar, Belgian waffle bar and lots of other options including meats, fresh fruits and cereals. Included valentinis were quite potent....stick with the mimosa. Check out was quick and efficient; no problems at all. My only complaint regarding this hotel was a cleaning issue. Our ice bucket had water from a previous guest's melted ice. Honestly, not a big issue as plastic liner was used and a new liner was provided. Two of the pillows (4 total) had a very bad smell....dirty, oily hair smell. The pillowcases themselves looked fine, but the smell was very strong. Either the pillowcases were not changed between guests or there is a problem with the pillows themselves. We didn't discover the problem until late so didn't call downstairs. We could use the other pillows provided. Other issue I had was there was a lot of street noise. We were on the 5th floor and had no problem hearing people/cars on the street below. There is also construction right next to the hotel. We didn't have any problems with construction noise over the weekend, but with the noise from normal activities being a problem, I would be concerned about the noise from construction. Overall, we enjoyed the stay and would stay here again, even with the issues noted.

Reviews.Title: “Super close to Conseco Fieldhouse”
Reviews.Author: rjmather
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls weekend away. Our room was a king business suite. Nice size room, clean linens, 2 closets (which is unusual). Lots of options for areas to get ready (i.e. put on makeup, do hair etc) which was nice for sharing a room with another female. At breakfast at the Severin Grille. Was concerned with watching my diet- not to worry. The buffet had many,many gluten free options along with fruit, yogurt- even gluten free granola. Along with artisan style bread and all the normal goodies you lucky non-fat challenged people can eat.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new fave en route to Ohio from Illinois.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFactor
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel as a mid-point when traveling from Illinois to Ohio if we get a late start driving. It's definitely a fave. I even search it out to see if it has available rooms, knowing that the construction in the area is a mess. My kid gets his explorer backpack when he arrives and cookies and milk, too. Little treats matter. BTW, the hotel is nice, great decor without feeling stuffy. If you tire of staying at family budget hotels but crave family friendly, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel...booked on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: suzbara
Reviews.Content: The room was big, beds were comfortable and the towels were huge. Booked it on priceline and was more than happy when it gave me the name Omni. Please note - $27 per night to valet park - and self park is around the block for $22. So.. much easier to Valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with very nice rooms. Beds are very comfortable. The location is great being so close to Lucas Oil stadium, lots of restaurants, and the shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Quality in the Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust127
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Omni many times and can say that it is a very well run property in a great location. If you are attending an event at the Lucas Oil Stadium, Conseco Field House or Indiana Convention Center, a short walk is all you will need. Also a short walk are plenty of restaurants, night life, bars, etc. Nearby (a longer walk or a short rise) is the State House, War Museum and many other cultural and civic attractions. The Omni itself is a handsome buidling with comfortable rooms and good service. On our last trip, we found that they had just completed a significant remodeling of the rooms, hallways, restaurant, etc., all of which was done very tastefully. There have been minor service gaffes on some visits, such as overlooking 2 requests for a rollout bed. On the other hand, we've been upgraded to a suite once or twice, so the good and bad tend to cancel each other out. Overall, considering the options available in downtown Indy, the Omni is a worthy choice and probably one of the best you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the word!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy R
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at this hotel. As a handicapped traveler going to Lucas Oil Stadium for 3 days, I was nervous about how difficult it would be to get around the hotel. I can't say enough wonderful things about how easy they made my stay! While they don't have an automatic handicap push button door, they don't need it. Every.single.time I got to that door I had at least 1 and usually 2 people running to get it for me! Whether it was at 7 am or after midnight, didn't matter, they were there. I never had to carry a thing, never had to lift a finger, never had to ask for anything. They anticipated my every need. The handicap rooms are the best I've ever stayed in. Room enough for even a motorized cart, they take into consideration every aspect of how it is to be in a wheelchair and provide for it. Do yourself a favor and don't miss the roast beef on the Sunday brunch...better than any steak I've ever had and trust me, I'm a steak freak. I had to call for housekeeping twice and guest services once for minor requests and each time I had someone to our door in less than 2 minutes. Whoever runs this hotel is either a magician at hiring the right people or has someone who is a whiz at teaching customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Old world hotel in the heart of Indy”
Reviews.Author: ellistravels
Reviews.Content: Old world style hotel right in downtown Indy. Near the convention center and walking distance to restaurants and shopping. Meeting space is extremely limited and our group was sold space that did not actually fit the size of our group (200 people for corporate meeting), making it difficult on site to fit everything in. Plus, I find in general in Indy that service staff has a bit of an attitude like you are bothering them when you ask for something. Or if you ask for a "couple of " anything (water, pens, etc), they will bring you one. Where I live, a "couple of" whatever always results in 2 or more of that item arriving. Also there is currently (July 2011) a lot of construction going on in downtown Indy in preparation for hosting the 2012 Super Bowl Game. Would not recommend this hotel for meetings or large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel in a great part of town for a tourist.”
Reviews.Author: 911daddy
Reviews.Content: What a great old hotel. Guest rooms were comfortable and staff was accomodating. Had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: milaurie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed here for the ATA show in January. We were very impressed with the hotel and the staff. we had a huge room and really loved it. I would recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: czechsue
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the front staff was very helpful. Very conveniently located for the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Indy Location!”
Reviews.Author: HomerTM
Reviews.Content: For three visits, the Omni Severin proved to be a great location with overhead walkway into a Norstrom's mall and within easy walking distance to Lucas Stadium, Conseco Field House, and many fine restaurants. This downtown area is easily accessible for $7 on the city's "green line" airport shuttle, for about $20 in a Carey Limo, or for somewhat more via local taxie.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Location”
Reviews.Author: mybeau
Reviews.Content: I would go back and stay at this hotel in a minute. Friendly, professional and helpful staff all around. Beautiful room makeover with nice TV. Yes, there is construction going on but I was on the 5th floor right above it and did not hear a thing. The location is perfect for everything downtown. It's very close to the stadium (Lucas Oil) if your lucky enough to have Supebowl tickets for 2012. This hotel is top shelf.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: normalhepkat
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference here and the city was in the middle of a heat wave. The hotel and room was very nice. However, the corridors and elevators were very stuffy due to the heat. This did not sway my positive opinion of the hotel. When you were in the main areas and your room the temperature was perfect. There was constructions going on outside but I never heard a thing. Additionally, the staff was EXTREMELY helpful and nice. I was at a conference and we had breakfast/break service. The hostess was beyond nice and helpful. For example, I mentioned that I did not really like Coke products (The official OMNI drink, I guess). However, I told her that it wasn't that big of an deal. Next thing you know, she was bring me the Diet Pepsi's that I wanted. Her name was Maria and if you have a conference there..make sure she's a part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel-would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kingsfan99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for my nephew's wedding. Many of my family stayed at the Crowne Plaza, and we almost did too. Ended up getting a slightly better rate at the Omni so stayed there. I'm glad we did, and most my family at Crowne Plaza wished they had booked the Omni. If you are choosing between the two when staying downtown, the Omni is nicer. We received a complimentary upgrade to suite! The lobby was very nice as a meeting up spot for friends and family. Rooms very clean. Just don't eat at the restaurant downstairs. It's good for watching some sports with a drink, but the food was not very good. Not a big fan of indoor pools, that's why I only gave it 3 stars for pool. But the pool was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: msbellamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel on May 31, 2011. When we checked in, we were treated like royalty. I believe the csr's name was Tamera. She signed us up for the frequent stayer program so we could get free internet, Our room was clean and decorated nicely. The pool area was also nice and clean. The fitness area was unbelievable. They had everything you could imagine. They provided ice water with cucumbers or lemon in the lobby. This was refreshing (no pun intended), as hotels usually just cater to coffee drinkers. The following day, we got breakfast to go at the restaurant. The ladies there were so helpful. The bellmen were also wonderful. They seemed truly interested in us, not just getting a tip. It's been years since I've stayed in an Omni. After this experience, we will seek them out. Great job to the management of this hotel. You have hired great people.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wonderfully Renovated Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgd-chi
Reviews.Content: I booked a king room at the Omni for my dad and his lady friend when they came to Indy for Father's Day weekend. When I saw the room, I was so jealous! The renovation of this hotel is outstanding. The high-end finishes, carpets, robes, furniture, accessories and bedding were extremely nice. This is a top-notch remodel, making this hotel on par with the new JW Marriott...maybe better, since this hotel is smaller and quieter. The room was huge and the bathroom was also a good size. I purchased the Circle Center Shopping package which included a gift card, outstanding brunch buffet at Severin Bar and Grill and valet parking...an outstanding value. Also, if you register for a frequent guest membership (which we did), morning coffee service (delivered to your door) and Internet are complimentary. The service was great. The staff was truly friendly and very helpful. Needless to say, Father's Day went great! I personally will stay there the next time I'm in Indy and would recommend it to friends or if you have family coming in from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice once again!”
Reviews.Author: AbeLIncoln,St.Louis
Reviews.Content: Returned for the first time in about 4 years and still just as wonderful....see my previous review. Missed the chocolate fondue in the lobby from before :) but maybe that was just a one time special. Very pretty room, lobby and facilities. Quiet, and just all around good. Went for business meeting where my family was included.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jamaicanmix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Severin for our 14th wedding aniverssary. The entire staff from the Reservations, the Front Desk, the Room service, and Valet were extremely professional and very courteous. They trully have a speak it and it shall be done attitude. This is our second time celebrating with the Omni, great both times. Their select guest perks are a welcome plus, beverages and newspaper, turndown service. The location of this hotel is better than others IMO. We also, like the balconies and the bi-level suites.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MSUSpartan94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Very clean, excellent service, great location. The breakfast buffet is incredibly expensive, but typical of what you get in a larger city.

Reviews.Title: “great place for events”
Reviews.Author: Jill093
Reviews.Content: We live near Indianapolis but stayed downtown for a family wedding at the Omni. Everything was amazing from the suite we stayed to the actual wedding and reception. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and professional - and it was one of the most organized and stressfree weddings we have every been to.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Old school Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDFAN080
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently under renovation. The King Bed room I had was new, very large, comfortable bed. Bathroom was large also, however the shower unit was from circa 1970 very tight quarters. Water pressure was a bit on the low side as well. I used the fitness center which is located in the basement, newer equipment. A couple of things that bothered me. 1) The $3.50 charge to deliver room service on top of the 21% added gratuity. 2) If your not a member of the the Omni Select program you will get charged 9.99 for wireless access. 3) No Hotel parking within the building, they hammer you for valet so if you want to self park, its across the street in a dungeon like facility or a public lot up the street. 4) there was some kind of construction going on outside the hotel which started at 7;30 am, it didnt bother me because I was up before that time but it would have been nice of the desk clerk to mention it cause it was loud. If you are familar with downtown Indianapolis, most of the main hotels are conected via an indoor walk way so that pretty conveinent. Now that I know the ins and outs of the property I would probably stay there again, just wouldnt use the room service or in house eateries.

Reviews.Title: “They played us!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel27
Reviews.Content: Ok let me start by saying i received a great price on the hotel. 89 per night on the weekend is great. All the other reviews are right, hotel is clean, no unauthorized charges on our card, good location(except there is construction all around the hotel). My only complaint is, i booked a queen size bed, and we received a full size! we checked in last night after 11, so i was too tired to complain. when i called to tell them, they acted like i was crazy! i told multiple people this is not a queen bed, i have one at home. the front desk said "we have no double beds on the property" then told me they were completely booked except for a room with 2 double beds! i am outdone! at least be honest and say maybe we made a mistake! i am having a baby next month, and this was our little get away before he is born,and i wanted the bed to be great.we leave tomorrow.no one believes anything should be done about our problem.other than that, the hotel is ok, but be aware their "queen size" are really full size!

Reviews.Title: “She's going downhill”
Reviews.Author: Rich01Cards
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Omni in downtown Indy for several years. My wife and I stayed one night for a quick weekend getaway in Feb 2011. Our disappointment started at arrival when we learned our reservation was not correct. They had us down for a double bed room when my reservation and profie clearly stated it was supposed to be a king bed. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk they indicated that no king room was currently availble and that the only one that woudl be available was just below the floors being renovated. There was never a note on the website about this hotel being under construction and repairs. The front desk finally said they could upgrade us for a $50 fee but quickly changed their position when I calmly suggested that was not acceptable. To their credit, even though this room was not yet ready either, they did take our bags upstairs so we could go about our day. When we finally made it to our room we were pleased about the size fo the suite. With that said, the room itself was very tired. The televisions were very old (no plasma or LCD's), the carpet was torn in the some locations, and the bathroom was very small and just odd. The room was clean and large but that's about it. The air/ heat sysetm was also very loud and did not seem to do a very good job keeping the room at a constant temp. The room in general was load with some of the construction during the late afternoon. The location of this hotel is great. The staff was very nice acroos the board. We were disappointed to see that the hotel condition has slipped since our last visit. We will likley look elsewhere when we book our next visit to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and upscale.”
Reviews.Author: jgflys
Reviews.Content: We had plans to stay at the Hyatt Regency for a romantic night away but after viewing 3 disgusting dirty rooms there including there nicest room we got our money back and started looking around. We stopped by the Omni by chance and fell in love the minute we walked in. The lobby is very nice and it smells excellent and clean. We wanted to see a room before we booked the the staff was very nice and helpful. After a quick look we booked our stay. The room was a bit tiny but it was excellent in everyway. But you can't expect much for a last minute stop. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFerguson
Reviews.Content: I had just returned from overseas when I traveled to Indianapolis and stayed at the Omni. An excellent hotel right downtown. Free wifi and shirt press if you join the Omni Rewards program. Will definitely stay here again when given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Wedding with snow falling and crystal chandeliers glowing.”
Reviews.Author: Banning
Reviews.Content: Left warm southern California for a Christmas wedding at the Omni. Greeted at the door by the staff late in the evening after 3 plane rides. We were taken care of very nicely and warmly. Room was clean and beds were so comfortable. We were there for 4 nights. The best part was the wedding ceremony and reception in the Omni ballrooms. Just gorgeous rooms with a grand staircase all decorated for Christmas. Crystal chandeliers beyond beautiful hung from each ballroom. The meal was wonderful. Service staff was friendly and courteous. And on Sunday the Colts were playing a home game so the Omni had a tailgate party in the lobby complete with music and food. Lots of good fun and supportive fans cheering. Also loved being able to go shopping in the mall which is connected to the Omni without going outside into the cold and snow. We would definitely stay at the Omni in Indianapolis again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel of choice in downtown Indy.”
Reviews.Author: Roos22
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is what sets the hotel apart. They are very attentive and helpful (except whoever the bartender after midnight on New Years Eve '10, she was very rude.) I loved the classic and rich decoration used throughout the hotel. The rooms are beautiful especially the penthouse with the full deck and window! The TVs are outdated, but are to be replaced soon. The bath was gorgeous, with adequate water pressure and plenty of towels. The only problem I have is I was charged and additional overnight valet parking fee, $27 which is very high. I have not called to question this yet. If this gets taking care of I will be referring all my business relations, friends and family to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Center of it all in Indy.”
Reviews.Author: WoolTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the ease of accessing things from my hotel in this metropolitan area. Restaurants, bars, cafes, theaters, sports, shopping are all VERY easy to access. The staff was extremely helpful with suggestions and directions. Although the hotel is scheduled for a renovation in the next few months, I thought it was in good shape despite some outdated decor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel in heart of downtown Indianapolis - The Omni staff is great!”
Reviews.Author: NLaycoax
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to spend New Year's Eve downtown Indy with some great friends, and staying at the Omni made it even better. It is right across the street from the bar that we rang in the new year at, Ike & Jonesy's, and the property is just gorgeous. When we checked in, we heard the celebration in the ballroom of a couple having their wedding party, and then were going to be married at midnight! The Omni is definitely a beautiful place to have a wedding if you are looking for a spot in Indy. The ballroom is so elegant, and the age of the hotel gives it a very unique and royal feel. The front desk and Severin Bar & Grille staff all had wonderful personalities. My last experience with the Omni in St Louis combined with this stay at the Omni in Indy has me convinced that the Omni really makes it a point to make excellent service the top priority when looking for talent to add to their teams. Our room was absolutely wonderful. The beds were very, very comfortable and spacious (it probably also helped that I'd been drinking :) ). But in all seriousness, I almost didn't want to leave the hotel because the room was that great. We brought our Wii with us also, so we were able to play video games after our night out, and there wasn't anything that I can say needed to be improved upon with the room. Breakfast in the morning was great. I am a bit of a biscuits & gravy connoisseur, and there aren't many that I've had that I give my approval on. The Severin B's & G's passed. The omelet station had a nice variety of toppings to choose from. There was plenty of fresh fruit, plus fruit & yogurt parfaits pre-made. Coffee was strong.... Just the way I like it. Seating was comfortable and roomy. Next time, I would like to try out the pool, and take a bit more of a tour so I can get more pictures. I do know that they are getting ready to start room renovations, so I will be excited to get back to check out what else they will do to make the already beautiful hotel even better. The location is perfect for folks coming to town for conventions, sporting events, families wanting to visit Indy, as well as anyone looking to walk around downtown and do some bar hopping and dancing. The hotel is right in the center of the bar district, so it eliminates cab fees and driving. I will definitely stay with the Omni Severin again, and I also recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay while in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and elegant”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays. Service is attentive and efficient. Yes, rooms are dated but it is an older hotel. Booked penthouse room which had a great balcony and view of monument, would be great room in warmer months. Hotel is connected to the mall via skyway which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: brya31
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate my wifes birthday. The staff was great, they left us some wine and delicious chocolate covered strawberries. The room was nice and clean. Location was perfect for a night on the town. Shopping, food and bars, cant beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBizDude
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Clean rooms. AC out of control, but was promptly attended to and fixed. Also a slight issue with bill, but again, the issue was solved rather quickly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ebcritic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient to everything downtown - we could not have chosen a better hotel. The staff was excellent from the valet crew to housekeeping. My only advice would be to set the thermostat fan to "on" instead of auto to drown out the street noise. We were on the 4th floor and could hear people, cars, and horses on the street below. The fan did the job. Perfect sleeping after that. Will defintely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “great place- great location”
Reviews.Author: tazzeewazy
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. My husband and I decided to go to a colts game on sunday night. This hotel was outstanding in hospitality. They even had a pre-party in the lobby with a DJ and drink stands with extra tv's everywhere- this was awesome. It was also very close to the stadium - about a 3 minute walk. Great for shopping because it was attached to the mall and also close to the bars/restaurants. Would love to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, but it can be better”
Reviews.Author: LennyG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's next to Lucas Oil Stadium, attached to a large mall and close to several nice bars and restaurants. The staff is very nice and helpful. However, despite being a higher-end hotel, the rooms themselves are not very impressive. Although clean, the rooms are small and relatively old (still have old CRT TV's, few plugs - some of which don't work well, not the greatest lighting). Also, $27 a night for parking in Indy?? That's a bit excessive. Wireless internet is available and pretty fast, but $10 a night (what's with low-end hotels giving free internet, but high-end ones nickel and diming you??).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan_TX
Reviews.Content: The Omni Severin was really impressive from the start. My flight came in early so they rushed the cleaning of my room while giving me a complimentary beverage of my choice in the lounge. The service was fantastic, hotel was clean, and it was located in a vibrant section of the city -- right next to the famous St. Elmo's Steak House and live music venues. Also, it is located directly next to the mall. The rooms were very clean -- the only downside was the narrow shower in the bathroom. Overall, great experience and I would definitely stay at the Severin again and continue to do business with Omni Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, great service”
Reviews.Author: pbutala
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Indianapolis for one night, on a business trip. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised: very clean rooms, great service, friendly staff, and a decent downtown location. My only reason I gave it a 4 star instead of a 5 is because the Wi-Fi isn't free. For business travel, it's almost necessary to have Wi-Fi to check work emails, and at a rate of $140/night, I was surprised it's not free. We also ate the resaurant, located right in the hotel. Very good value---our meals were reasonably priced, and fast service.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhicklen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location for downtown convention. The staff at this hotel was exceptionally helpful and friendly, particularly Matt. They were quick to approach and offer advice, help, dinner recommendations and reservations. We had trouble with the airport car service they arranged and they credited charge without being asked and arranged other transportation. Rooms are on the smaller side, but very clean and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “First class business standard hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherEnglishman
Reviews.Content: All I want in a hotel when I'm traveling on business is a large, clean, comfortable room, free wifi, polite and helpful staff, a bar with good snacks and plenty of screens showing baseball, and a location that allows me to stagger back from good restaurants. The Omni Severin has it all, with style. I got the corporate rate of a large local company, but even at the Internet rate they'd be good value. I'll be visiting Indy a lot over the next year or so this is where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, luxurious stay.”
Reviews.Author: commishonwheels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a wedding. First, the reception, held at the Omni was magical. The food was good, the venue was amazing, and the drinks were plentiful and good. The front staff was so helpful, and our room was upgraded to a suite. Beds were comfortable, and there is no better location for right downtown. Might not be the most convenient for the convention center, Lucas Oil or White River Gardens, but definitely best located for Conseco Fieldhouse, Meridian Street and the Circle. Had a perfect stay. Parking (there is none on site) is the only complication.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for Lucas Oil Stadium events”
Reviews.Author: CharlieChiWeenie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend Colts game. Hotel about two or three block easy walk from stadium. Plenty of easy pay parking lots nearby or valet for $27. Hotel common areas are very nice, staff is friendly, and rooms are clean, well decorated, and comfortable. There are nearly a zillion good restaurants and bars within easy, safe walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable experience.”
Reviews.Author: pj_mcgowan
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful - from the valet service, room quality, to check out. Beds were very comfortable. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not Snobbish, Efficient but never Intrusive”
Reviews.Author: Eyesofapoet
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT Hotel!!! The staff we interacted with were both professional and friendly. It was a very busy weekend but the lobby, elevators and pool were meticulously maintained. Our room was very clean and quiet. We had a wonder time and it was in no small part to this great establishment.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT AND COURTESY”
Reviews.Author: cdfs
Reviews.Content: The staff here was so exceptional. Treats for our dog and a surprise birthday treat for the humans too! Lovely and quiet room, clean and amazingly updated for the age of the property. Great location. The only negatives are the extras--$50 deposit for our small dog and $27 for valet parking in a non-secured public garage. We were able to keep our car in front of the hotel but that was just lucky. I'd stay again in a heartbeat!! but with those two add-ons, it was more costly than we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: eclando
Reviews.Content: I've never bothered to leave a review before but this hotel deserves a good one. This is the second time we have stayed here and were even more pleased this time. Staff and service were really exemplary. Last time it was just my husband and me and it was a quick overnight, this time we checked in with two young kids for a weekend. 10 minutes after we were in our room they showed up with milk and cookies for the kids....and as we left on Sunday the valets gave us bottles of cold water for the trip. Room service and food was great....I really can't say enough good things about the whole experience. My kids were quite impressed!!! The lobby bar was great for people watching....all around highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Option”
Reviews.Author: ccraven001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Severin in July 2010. The hotel is in downtown Indy. The rooms, especially the beds, are clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean but could use a bit of an update. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of everything you'd need---restaurants, Einstein bagels, CVS and more. The one drawback is the parking situation. Upon arrival, the valet staff were "confused" about the location of self-parking. As they described it, I would have had to walk quite a distance. Upon hearing this, I chose the valet option. However, when I went on my walk the next morning, it was clear that there were parking garages everywhere (just not immediately visible to this out-of-towner). I usually stay at Starwood hotels but the Indy Westin is too beat up for me to stay at. I'll be back to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-free!”
Reviews.Author: mos912
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here during the DCI finals this past weekend. We did bid for the rooms on Priceline, and I'm so glad this was our winning bid. After reading some of the negative reviews prior to leaving, I was expecting to apologize to my family upon our arrival. The lobby was lovely and very comforable ... with the heat feeling like 110 outside, it was nice to have an ice cold glass of lemon (or cucumber) water (and a fresh apple) available at all times (no charge). The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the staff went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We checked in early and wanted our two rooms to be adjoining. They weren't ready yet, so they stored our luggage and called us as soon as the rooms were available (not necessary as we were at the state fair) which was within 30 minutes. Even if we had stayed nearby, it wasn't a long wait. The valet, porter, front desk, manager, head of housekeeping, engineering, and those who answered our calls were ALL involved in our stay and each one made sure we were satisfied even if it was beyond their control. We needed a cot for the second day of the trip and even though it was mentioned casually when the head of housekeeping stopped by to see if we needed anything (our door was open) ... it was there first thing in the morning. After checking out on our final day, I realized that I left my cellphone and a nintendo ds in the room. We called and within minutes it was waiting at the front desk. Because they are within a short walking distance to Lucas Oil Stadium, it wasn't a stressful wait. One elevator was out of commission during our whole stay and the wait was up to 10 minutes for each trip .... I can't tell you how many people apologized for this and at one point, the manager waited with us and the next day, she walked my daughter up the stairs because she was in a hurry to get to the room The bolt lock between rooms wouldn't budge, but staff arrived immediately to resolve the problem. It had to be replaced, but it wasn't an inconvenience because we didn't need to close the door, once opened. It was repaired by the time we got back to the hotel the next afternoon. I agree with those who said the $27 is a lot to pay, we did park the car on the street for two days (it's very well-lit and there was no problem with crime). The hotel was very convenient to Lucas Stadium, the mall, and tons of restaurants. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. During the last day of our trip, we stayed in a 3-star hotel and it looked like a 1-star when my family compared it to the experience we just had. Sorry this is long, but it was one of our most enjoyable hotel stays (and we spend a lot of time in Disney hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: greenbean9265
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Great valet service - which you have to use as there is NO visibe parking. I have no idea where they parked my car. Was only there briefly so not able to provide review on anything other than appearance, valet service, front desk & room. 2 negatives: major elevator down @ time of stay was a pain. And there is no sign outside the hotel & the street address is Jackson Place - that "street sign" is tiny and off the road. We drove by it once - only by luck and prayer did we find it again and there is A LOT of action right there. That would be my only advice to the owners - put up a sign for heavens sake!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ohio-Brown-Eyed-Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for the Drum Corps International World Championships. This is a major event held at Lucas Oil Stadium, and this hotel was perfectly located in close proximity to the stadium and also to various restaurants, shopping, etc. The hotel isn't brand new and the rooms show a little age, but it certainly isn't run down. Positives: Location, including skyway to mall; Our king room was comfortable and completely quiet; If you join the rewards program, you get free beverage service to your door in the morning; if you pay a little bit, you can get some food too. So I think we paid like $11 total to have two orange juices, a pot of coffee, and two bagels and cream cheese delivered to our door; The lobby is pretty and the lobby bar was accomodating; they stayed open late (2am?)due to our event in town and the two female bartenders were working their tails off! (kudos!); Negatives It is a downtown hotel . . .you're going to pay steep prices for parking, food, etc.; Vanity in the bathroom is very small; It isn't "new" . . .the TV isn't flat screen, etc. Overall, a nice stay. Thanks for making the DCI crowd feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Go some where else.... :(”
Reviews.Author: ace_of_narf
Reviews.Content: Paid for Valet... I was told my car got broken into over the night. it was 1 of like 7. I found my card in a public parking with across the street NO Security. Walls are paper thin. You can hear the water in the pipes. Pool is like a group hot tub. it was not place I will ever go back to. Omni told me too talk with the subcontracted company that did their Valet for them. I would not stay there again I would stay at a hole in the wall before going back there. P.S. noisy, smelly, old building

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmsimp05
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well kept. It was located in a great area. walking distance to shopping and restaurants and also connected to Centre City Mall. Only a few minute drive to the zoo and the canal which is beautiful. The staff was extremly helpful even printed off directions for us to some places we wanted to go. They were always quick getting our cars and were always accomodating. The price of the rooms were extremely reasonable. I was very pleased and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Staff was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “WIll never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: OutofOH
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis for one night with my 19-yr-old daughter. Checked into the hotel around 9:00 - just wanted to watch a movie and get a good night's sleep. The room was disappointing - as other reviewers have said it was run down and not furnished/finished like a 4-star hotel room. The TV reception was abysmal - very grainy picture, even when watching a PPV movie. Very loud AC cycled on and off all night. Woke up at 5:45am to the phone ringing - "hello, Mrs. OutofOH, this is your 5:45am wakeup call!" - a wakeup call I DID NOT REQUEST! How does that happen?! The manager slipped a $10 restaurant coupon under the door with an apologetic note, so we decided to use it toward a room service breakfast, which was a big mistake. Ordered 2 diet Cokes with extra ice - got warm bottled Cokes with NO ice (or even glasses for that matter.) Egg came on a plate - everything else (toast, bagel, cinnamon roll) came wrapped in napkins. No plates? seriously? No cream cheese for the bagel either. Checked out and retrieved car from valet parking. After we left, we noticed that both the GPS and satellite radio had been removed. After stopping and searching we found them hidden in two different places in the car. I appreciate the effort to keep my belongings safe, but it would have been nice to know up front that the $27/night valet parking was in a public garage that was deemed so unsafe by hotel management that such precautions are necessary. There are a couple of other true 4-star hotels in downtown Indy, as well as at least one much nicer 3-star. We will not stay here again, and frankly, it makes me leery of other Omni properties.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa8282
Reviews.Content: I am employed with a major airline. With that said , I am a guest at a great number of hotels. Our family had the pleasure of staying at this Omni for our daughters Jr. Olympic track meet that was hosted in Indianapolis. The Omni was truly one of the most positive, and pleasurable experiences we have ever had.... The service that we experienced from every staff member we came in contact with was above & beyond expectations. The follow-up I received after losing an item was very impressionable. We have reservations at the Ritz Carlton Chicago next weekend, and are strongly considering cancelling for the Omni Chicago.... Highly recommend this property.....

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: kilarney1
Reviews.Content: On a positive note, the staff is very friendly and accomodating and the lobby is pretty. But that's where it ends. This hotel is very old and in dire need of a renovation. The rooms are old, the bathroom fixtures are old, the smell in the rooms is musty and old, the furniture is old, the TV's are old, the A/C units are loud and old, the Internet service is lacking, the mattresses are hard, and parking is expensive. And if you happen to be faciing some of the bars on a lower floor, don't expect to get a good night's sleep. This was my first experience with Omni and needless to say it was not a good one. When the hotel is renovated later this year, it will very likely be 4 diamond again. But as a seasoned traveler, I can tell you that this is not up to industry standard. For example, I am currently staying in a 3 star, new, Cambria Suites motel and for $50 less a night and free parking, it is so much nicer and cleaner. Like night and day! I even lost a lot of data on my laptop because of a power surge when I plugged it in to the wall outlet in the room! This never happened to me anywhere and it caused me a lot of stress. I have to take my hard drive to a Best Buy and hope they can recover some of the data. And the Internet didn't even work once I could boot up again! The sales manager did take care of my room charge after I asked him to (he did not offer to, which was strange), but I had to drive 300 miles on no sleep today in terrible rain because of the poor conditions in my room. I was nauseus from the moldy, smoky smell in the room. Very sad how the owners have let the place go. It could be a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: PhantomHelm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in this hotel, and it's everything a decent hotel should be.
