The price was reasonable, the room large with comfortable beds, plenty of towels, iron and ironing board, TV and minibar, and a great view of the Lucas Oil Stadium. The decor in the rooms is perhaps a little dated when compared with a modern hotel, but perfectly acceptable and most importantly spotlessly clean. My room was air conditioned, very useful considering the temperature outside... The hotel has a grill downstairs, and serves a good breakfast and decent food. There's a walkway into the adjoining Circle Centre Mall. The staff were very friendly and helpful. How could it be improved? Charging $5 for a bottle of water in the room is a bit mean, and the old favourite of charging £13 a day for internet access.....But next time I go to Indy, I'll be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, within walking distance to pubs and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Holzwurm99
Reviews.Content: I ended up with the Omni through a Hotwire booking. Upon check-in, I tried to change my room to a king from the typical Hotwire 2 double bed reservation. A king room was not available but upon entering the room, I was happy to notice the overall size of the room that's needed to house 2 double beds. The bathroom was clean and modern. A regular tube tv but otherwise modern. Valet parking is $27 I think but you can park yourself next door in a parking garage if you want to save $5. Next time, I'll use the valet service. My room was right behind the elevators (likely because of the Hotwire booking) but I found the room to be surprisingly soundproof. The bedding was very comfortable. I did not eat at the hotel due to the many options within walking distance. For the best shrimp cocktail in the world, walk up one block to St. Elmo's.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: eliza81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for business. The conference we were attending was in the same hotel. Though an older building it is well maintained and quite lovely especially the more historical portions. Good location downtown, walking distance to many restaurants and attached to a very large mall. Great shopping! The only thing I'd rate low is the food at the Grill and what was served to us during the conference. Some things were great other were so-so. There are a lot of other places to eat nearby though so not a deal breaker. Try Kilgore Pub. Good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night”
Reviews.Author: Mrstodd4_19_10
Reviews.Content: The service was fantasic! I made a comment at check in about it being our wedding night, they brought up strawberries and sparkling wine shortly after. We went out with friends, and when we returned they had rose petals on the bed... So sweet! We didn't drink the wine, because we had already had a few too many drinks, but it was pretty bottom shelf so I didn't feel bad... But hey, free makes everything taste better when we get around to drinking it. My dad paid $207 for the room, I wouldn't pay that price unless if we recieved a bigger one next time. I was happy overall. We didn't eat there because of the prices, (we just paid for a wedding) but next time, if we have a reason to stay we will eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: speksy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Immaculately kept with friendly staff, it has great amenities including a great spa gym, swimming pool, and rooms that are comfortable. The best part though is the mall it is connected to and the surrounding area that will keep you occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Omni - Indy (Downtown)”
Reviews.Author: smashthings
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & staff, very awesome location for those who like the bar scene....

Reviews.Title: “awful experience”
Reviews.Author: susiespy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was hosting a high school basketball conference and was so packed with screaming teenageers and parents that we could not even use the elevators. Our room, which had a TINY bathroom was on the12th floor. We were in town for a wedding and had to use the stairs, which didn't have egress to the lobby. The location is great, but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for a convention/business stay”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRed
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this elegant hotel. I was in town for a conference and chose it because of their wireless (more on that in a moment). It's just a couple blocks from the convention center, very walkable, and attached to the mall. The staff was friendly and check-in/out was quick. The room was very clean (very important) but small, though it was fine for one person. The bed was a bit hard, but there wasn't any outside noise. I was glad to have their coffee shop in the mornings and there are a lot of restaurants within walking distance. Here's a hint: join their loyalty club to get free wireless. It didn't cost anything to join and it was such a relief to stay somewhere that didn't charge $10+ just to go online.

Reviews.Title: “Parking.??.. anyone??”
Reviews.Author: midwestgator
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing with a nice restraunt and bar inside. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis' nightlife centered around Ike&Jones, Cadialac Ranch, Have a Nice Day Cafe,...... many more. Clubs for all ages. The only downside is there was no parking. You have the option to pay for vallet parking which is about 25 a day but I just thought that shold have came with the room.. Overall the location was hard to beat for the AFC championship game.... right accross the street from Lucus Oil Stadium... Go Colts!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you check your vehicle after valet parking for damage!! They damaged mine and don't want to pay for the repair”
Reviews.Author: Kors_7
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel on the 25th of Jan. Departed on Jan 27th. I used their valet service when I arrived. My vehicle was kept in valet parking during the entire stay. I never took it out until departure. On departure I requested my vehicle be brought to me. The valet attendant pulled up with my vehicle and he got out leaving my driver door open. I open the back hatch a placed my bag inside and closed the back hatch went to the driver door, got in and drove away. On my way home I had to make a stop for a restroom break and when I opened my driver door to get out of the vehicle the door made a loud popping noise. I looked and seen that my driver door was hitting the front fender each time the door was opened and chipping the paint away. When I close the door there were no noises, it is only when the door gets opened and that would explain why the attendant left my driver door open. He didn't want me to notice something is wrong. Any other valet services that I have used in the past would always close my door to build heat in the winter and cool in the summer. So after I noticed this I immediately called the hotel to spoke to Mr. Barker at the valet department and he informed me that when I got home to take pictures of the vehicle and send them to him in a e-mail. When I got home I did just that...took the photos and e-mailed them to him that evening. I waited 2 weeks for a response and heard nothing. I called Mr. Barker and he informed he didn't get the e-mail (imagine that) he advised me to send it to him again but he didn't think that any thing could be done about it. I describe the attendant to him in the e-mail and described the damage that had been done just like Mr Barker had told me to do. Now all of a sudden there is "nothing that can be done". I am going to give it a week or so to see what the response is and will update this. DO NOT USE THE VALET SERVICE. Hotel rooms were very small and bathroom was so small you couldn't hardly turn around. Other than that the hotel was OK

Reviews.Title: “Omni Family Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tamrn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Severin hotel for my son's birthday. We went to see Monster Jam at Lucas Oil Stadium. Location was perfect. Easy and short walk to the stadium. Our room was great. Double room was huge! The kids got backpacks filled with toys and treats. They also had milk and cookies waiting in the room. Staff was friendly and attentive. Definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: stejacks
Reviews.Content: Stay here for a wedding at the hotel. Everything was a beautiful setup. The suites have a great view of the city and perfect spot for fourth of July fireworks! Mini bar in the rooms. Beds were cozy. Right in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Like family...”
Reviews.Author: 1mule
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed over the christmas holiday for three days. It was for her birthday and when we arrived in our room there was a small birthday cake and a bottle of bubbly! The cake was very good, chef quality, but i cannot say for the bubbly as we don't drink. This was not our first time at the severin, we had previously stayed this past summer for the july 4th holiday. Everybody at the omni is super friendly, Sara and Anne at the front desk even remembered us! It truly is like visiting family when you return to the hotel. Marion had arranged for the cake and took care of all the details of our trip. This is a top notch hotel where they know how customer service is susposed to work! This is a very friendly hotel, and when you go you feel like family......

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rymy
Reviews.Content: Went to a wedding and had a great time. Hotel had cookies and milk sent to the room for our kids. We had a large room with two beds. Staff was very good and they had a pool for the kids. Be patient if you valet park. It does take a while to get your car if you try at a busy time. We would definitely stay again but we did get a rate of $125 for New Years.

Reviews.Title: “Just oK”
Reviews.Author: pattiafp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Severin for a week and have to say that it was just OK. My biggest gripe is that the room was very dark with bad lighting throughout. Bathroom was small with no counter space. Not a great place for a long stay... much better for a quick weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby but small room”
Reviews.Author: alkel18
Reviews.Content: The Omni has a great entrance and lobby, good restaurant option and good service. I was a bit disappointed in the hotel overall, the hallways and doors to the rooms felt like an old mid-range hotel that was renovated halfway. My room was nice but definitely small - I had a room with one Queen and everything was a tight fit but fine for a single business traveler. The towels were not that soft which is something I expect from a hotel like Omni. I've stayed at a few others (Shoreham in DC and one in Dallas area) and thought the other two were a bit more elegant overall. The location was great, although further from the Convention Center than I expected - but you can get there without going outside in the cold by walking through the mall. It's about a 8-10 minute walk through everything to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: monetsgardens
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Nice room with quality features. My Step-Daughter was given a childrens back pack kit and milk and cookies where in the room for her. Small touches that were thoughtful. Great location easy to get to and the Valet parking was worth the extra cost. The pool was out of order but they arranged for us to use the pool a the hotel across the road which was lovely. We got a great deal through Omni and I would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like royalty!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyCarFan3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Severin last weekend and it will be our home away from home from now on! We were in Indy to visit our son and from the moment we drove up to the front door on Friday evening we were treated like royalty! Troy unloaded everything from our car and met us inside with our things at the front desk, where we were greated with smiles and warm greeting from all the lovely ladies! From there John took us, with our luggage, up to our spacious, beautiful, absolutely spotless suite! He removed our things from his cart, showed us around, filled our ice bucket and left his card in case there was anything else we needed during our stay! We stopped in the 40 West Cafe and received excellent service from Drew and Adam, along with a big cup of one of Drew's specialty hot chocolates! It was wonderful!! Our Saturday morning started off with the delicious breakfast buffet at the Omni Grill. Monica, Missy, and Lucas greeted us with smiles and gave us the pleasure of being treated to Lucy's great service and Michaels fabulous omelets!! Yum! A must have for anyone staying here!! Sunday morning brought us back to 40 West Cafe for breakfast sandwiches and a banana nut muffin, both delicious! Again, a great morning greeting from Drew along with coffee and another specialty hot chocolate, this time the Cloud 9! Wow!! As we came and went through the Omni all weekend we were always greeted with smiles and kind words, many employees introduced themselves to us. Nick, one of the Guest Ambassadors, called us by name each time he saw us and that was very impressive! What a nice young man!! This is a beautiful hotel right in the heart of Indianapolis that is absolutely overflowing with a fantastic staff and wonderful amenities! We can't wait to come back, in fact we are planning an additional trip there in December now!! I would strongly encourage anyone to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay in this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: swimparents
Reviews.Content: We found the Omni Severin to be delightful. Our room was exceptionally clean; the staff was very friendly; the amenities were lovely. This hotel is wonderfully located to enjoy all the activities (sports, shopping, restaurants, leisure) in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, if inconsistent housekeeping. Don't rent a car, take the bus!”
Reviews.Author: Jbeebo
Reviews.Content: A 1 week business trip finds me in downtown Indy at the Omni. They have very good rates compared to the local competition. Hotel is clean, beds comfy. Views were not the best, but its Indy afterall... Ordered room service breakfast one time, was quite tasty. If you sign up for their frequent stay program (free) then you get free wireless and 2 free beverages every morning. The housekeeping was inconsistent. Sometimes they'd bring cream with my morning coffee, sometimes not. Sometimes the local paper as requested, sometimes not. One evening at 6:30pm I returned to find the cleaning lady using my bathroom. She had turned down the bed and then decided to drop a bomb while she was there - nasty! I was not impressed. The rest of the staff was very nice, courteous and helpful. The location is very convenient. If you haven't been to Indy in a while, the downtown is quite nice and safe. There are many restaraunts and bars nearby, shopping too. Most buildings are linked with covered walkways so exposure to the elements is minimal. Do NOT rent a car unless you plan on going outside of the downtown core. Parking is $25 each day (not included in the room charge), but this is the cheapest downtown and it gives unlimited in/out access. The valet is slammed in the morning, expect to wait 15minutes or more for your car if at peak times (7am). Bus service to/from the airport is good and cheap ($7 express 15minute travel time). Buses throughout the rest of the city are pretty good, but run infrequently past 8pm. I did rent a car and turned it in a day later after hitting the outskirts a couple times for good restaraunts. After that, stayed downtown and enjoyed the food there. Overall, a positive stay at the Omni. If I return to Indy I'd stay again, but this time not bother with the car rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice beds, staff was quick with service and very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Reau482
Reviews.Content: Brought our little Yorkie with us, she received a doggie bag with treats and a lot of affection from the staff! Good location for sporting events and walking downtown. Very happy wtih hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Manager NOT Hotwire Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: pianomarm
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by the Front Desk Manager at the Omni. Severin. The booking was for one room for three adults, but she planned to assign us one queen bed. When I pointed out the obvious problem, she stated that since I had booked through Hotwire that the hotel could not guarantee the type of accommodations as when booked directly through Omni. When asked if they had a room with two doubles, they did. Eventually the Front Desk Manager assigned us to a room with two doubles, but all the while she made derogatory comments about Hotwire and other third party reservation agents. When she lectured, strongly suggesting that in the future that I not try to save a “few dollars”, but make direct reservations that allowed the hotel to accommodate us, I spoke up. I told the Front Desk Manager that I would use her name when responding to the Hotwire survey. Her attitude was “snotty” and argumentative. In the end, I felt that because I did not pay full rate, that she felt I did not have enough money to stay at the Omni. This is an absolute FIRST in all the years that I’ve used Hotwire. To continue the story, I called down from my room to speak to the manager. When summoned, it was same Front Desk Manager. Therefore, I had no recourse. Later that evening, I returned to my room to find a small cheese and fruit snack had been delivered as a peace offering. However, the door to my room was left wide open! Anyway, if you plan to book through a third party agent, it is important to know that the Omni Severin (or one important employee) does not seem to appreciate you filling their empty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: teacherin2007
Reviews.Content: We went to Indianapolis for pleasure. It was a great surprise to get such a wonderful hotel at such a great price. We were downtown within minutes of all we wanted to see. Our room was wonderful, the people working there very helpful and the food great. We are planning our next trip back there for a Colts game!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: th673789
Reviews.Content: Nice stay at the Omni. Great location, almost everything is within walking distance. VERY helpful staff. However, small rooms. No spa or hot tub. No parking unless you are willing to pay $25 a day. No concierge. Dingy pool area.Three stars for sure, but not four. Definately sign up to become a select guest before going. You get your choice of room types, free beverages and newspapers in the morning, and express check in.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - become a "select guest" first”
Reviews.Author: MagginFL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Severin Hotel recently on a business trip to Indianapolis. I can't speak much to the value of the hotel because my company paid for the room, but I can tell you it was a definitely a decent hotel. I feel like the other reviews on this hotel have been a little unfair. One thing though that is very important is before your stay, go to the Omni website and sign up to be a "select guest". It's free, you just have to plug in your info, and what it gets you is free wireless internet (normally they charge $10 a day I think) and free drinks and newspaper each day of your stay. Also, as a select guest you get to tell them your room preferences - smoking/non-smoking (I think all hotels should be non-smoking personally), near or far away from the elevators, high floor/low floor, king sized or 2 double beds, corner room, etc. This I found to be just awesome because I selected all of my preferred criteria and I got the top floor, furtherest from elevators, king sized bed and a corner room, so 5 windows overlooking the city - it was great. I strongly suggest that if you go with this hotel you sign up as a select guest, it makes sense. I found the hotel in general to be nice, the carpets were in need of a change, but I didn't really mind that so much. I had a broken window when I checked in but the staff promptly came up and fixed it. The treadmills in the work out room squeeked very loudly, I suggest the hotel looks into fixing that. It was so loud, if someone else were there (I was alone in the room) I would have stopped immediately because they would have grabbed their ears and ran out of the room. Overall, everyone was friendly, it was clean. If my company hadn't paid for the room I would've felt OK about spending maybe $125-$150 a night on it - but I'm a bargain hunter so there you have it.

Reviews.Title: “So disapointed we left and stayed at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: swilfong
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms. All of the rooms had only one double bed. Two full size adults sleeping in a double bed... I don't think so. We requested a roll away in each room but they said they could not because the hotel was "at capacity" and that would be in violation of the fire marshal. In one room the air conditioner did not work. The room had to be 80 degrees. We opened the door to get cool air from the hall. The maintenance person took the unit apart and said that it was indeed broke and it would take awhile. We said that is enough, we are leaving. The front desk said they had no other rooms available. We went to Marriott downtown (Nice!) and decided to call the Omni and as we suspected - they said they had rooms available with 2 doubles or king. The worst part about the whole experience is that we came to Indianapolis because my neice was having brain sugery at Riley Hospital and we were looking forward to nice relaxing family time before the big day and unfortunatly it was filled with even more stress.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on hotwire hoping to get a good 4 star hotel for $80(incl taxes-$97). The only positive for this hotel is that it is close to Lucas Oil stadium. But there are many other hotels nearby. It is NO WAY a 4 star hotel. The lobby is a 3 star but the restaurant prices are 4 star! The room is smaller than any 4 star hotel I have seen. It is dark and crowded. There is an archaic old CTV with basic channels. The bed was fine but there was only a small window facing the top of a mall. The bathroom was the WORST!! The tub was as small as 4 feet! the sink was to a corner and by far the smallest I have seen. The hallways were dingy and carpet old and dirty. Overall this place is not worth more than $50 on hotwire. You will also have to factor in the parking charges of $25. Also for a 4 star hotel there is no wireless internet. These days 2-3 star hotels offer free internet. Overall a worthless place and will never place a 4 star for Indy on Hotwire. I believe this place got the 4 star based on other Omni hotels and does no justice to the Indy hotel. I hope Hotwire downgrades the hotel to a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but one small issue that created a tacky factor”
Reviews.Author: dannycarlucci
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Omni for a meeting that was being held at the hotel. I would like to start by saying that the staff was wonderful. They were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel itself is nice, but a bit worn. It could use an updating. The configuration of the room was a little odd, and the bathroom, although a decent size, was configured poorly. There was very little counter space (I mean very little). The hotel had a decent sized gym. There was also a pool, but it was small and the area around the pool was not particularly attractive. The hotel has an attractive location. It is directly connected to a mall, which also contains many places to eat, as well as a movie theater and an arcade. There are also many bars and restaurants in the area. The hotel is very close to Conseco Fieldhouse and within walking distance to the new Colts Stadium. Now for the tacky factor. Traveling for business, I usually send my materials ahead to the hotel where I am staying so that I do not have to carry them on the plane. For this trip, it was a small-to-medium sized box with 17 presentations inside. The Omni charged $10 to receive and hold the box for my arrival. This is the only hotel that I stayed at that has ever done this. All in all, the Omni was a nice hotel with an attractive location. I would stay here again. However, that charge just left me with a tacky feel about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_Family3
Reviews.Content: We had a King Suite so we had windows on 3 sides which offered us a great view of the stadium as well as a huge pile of what used to be the old RCA Dome. Pros - The bed was very comfy, the room was large enough for friends to come visit; the location was great for walking to see the history in the area as well as some great dining experiences. Valet service was extremely polite and very knowledgeable. Terry is awesome and gave us the best ideas on things to do! Cons - A tad on the pricey side, the valet is $25 per use, not per night, the bathroom is small with no fan. It could use a vanity area outside the bathroom. Terry the parking valet gave us some places to see and we did as many as we could fit into our stay. We ate at St. Elmo's and Le Pepe, visited Memorial Circle and the surrounding areas as well as the Capital and the Union Station hotel across the street. All of these were in walking distance to the hotel so that is a huge bonus for us. The bed is by far the softest we've ever encountered in a hotel. We were given plenty of pillows and the down comforter was so warm that even with the balcony door open on a cool night we were hot! The King Suite has a nice living room area that was laid out very well along with a neat balcony. Our last night there was before some Supercross Event at the stadium so some kids were running up & down the hallways and stairs at 11 pm. We did call the front desk who did get security involved, although she seemed a little put out by our request. They called a short while later to confirm that things were quiet so that was a very nice touch. Other than that and our extra $25 fee for valet (since we needed our car one day) we don't really have anything bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ainchsmom3x
Reviews.Content: We stayed 23rd-25th of January. My husband and I were getting away from our kids for a little R & R. Husband picked this hotel because of other reviews on this site. We booked through the hotel web site directly and got a government rate which made this hotel affordable to us on our tight budget. With the government rate we received free valet parking and free ($5.00 worth per person, each day) of food from the Starbucks located in the hotel. Husband signed up for the select guest program before making the reservation which gave us the bonus of robes to wear, turn-down service and two complementary drinks in the morning each day with a newspaper of choice. We were also given the options of picking hotel room area because of being a select guest. We requested a higher floor and away from elevators. We were given a room on the 12th floor. We also received a corner room, so we had windows on two sides of the building. We had a fantastic view of Indianapolis. Since we had a corner room, our room was probably larger than most rooms. It was very nicely decorated and the king size bed was very comfortable, especially if you like firm mattresses. The bathroom is very small and hard to maneuver in. It has a pedestal sink, so there is no room to put any of your personal hygiene items. Two people can not get ready at the same time in the bathroom. The bathroom door opens into the bathroom, so you have to close it to be able to stand in front of the sink to use the mirror. There is no fan, and since the bathroom is so small, it gets very steamy very fast. A curved shower curtain bar would be of great help to give more room in the shower, because it's a tight fit to shower (we are tall, skinny people). When we checked in, one light bulb was out in the bathroom and I thought the staff would replace it the next day, but they didn't. Not worth complaining about. The hotel is connected to Circle City Mall, so it's very useful to be able to walk through the mall to get to other areas in the city when it's so cold outside. We were able to walk just a couple of blocks outside to get to the ISO and to visit the Soldiers & Sailor's Monument Museum and btw there is a elevator that takes you up in the monument for 1.00 (we have lived in the area for 3 years and never knew you could go up in the monument!) They have a decent exercise room, which we used one morning and it was sufficient to what we use at our YMCA. It got quite crowded around 9a.m. on Saturday morning, so we were glad to have gotten there a little before that. They have a small pool area that we did not use, everyone said the water was warm. Our stay would have been perfect, except that there was some sort of convention in the area in which many, many, many teens had taken over the hotel. (Remember we were trying to get away from our two teens and our young one). For some reason on both Friday & Saturday night, teens were running around on the 12th floor making lots of noise. On Saturday night, husband called and requested that someone take care of it. In addition, Friday night one elevator was not working in the west tower, which is where we were, and we were late getting to our activity due to the waiting of an elevator. (we were on the 12th floor). Saturday, there was an elevator out in both the east and west tower. We had rushed ourselves to get to the lobby by the 12p.m. check out time and ended up waiting quite a bit on the west side for an elevator. After 10 minutes, we walked to the east tower and waited another 10 minutes, when the elevator opened, it was full of people. 2 more elevators came to the 12th floor and they also were full. I finally called to the front desk to tell them that we had been trying to get to the lobby for 1/2 hour to check out and couldn't get an elevator. We finally got an elevator and had to squeeze on with our luggage. It turns out that people had been waiting so long to get an elevator that was going down, that they started hopping on the elevator even if it was going up because they knew at some point it would go back down again, hence the reason it kept coming up to the 12th floor and it was full. When we finally got down to the front desk to check out. The staff had no idea that there was such a problem getting an elevator. (they knew that two of their elevators were out-they just didn't know that people were getting on when it was going up just to come back down again) I was confused why they (the hotel staff) weren't "problem solving" and maybe calling their guests to say that there was a problem with elevators and that they had extended check out time or putting an employee in each elevator to help control the flow of traffic. The whole lobby was filled with these teens and their groups all waiting for their transportation, it was a total mess. The gal checking us out said that she would call ahead and request our car for us. It still took 45 minutes for us to finally get our car. The whole process was total chaos and then on top of it, the gal trying to get our car couldn't figure out how to unlock the car properly and so the car alarm kept going off when she tried to start it, and instead of coming to get some help right away she kept trying to figure out. Finally someone came to get my husband to tell him what was going on and so my husband had to go and get his own car! The hotel offered us a free upgrade. I thought they were offering us a free night to try the hotel again, but they were only offering us a free upgrade on a room. This was disappointing because we do live in the area and I am just not sure if I could recommend the hotel again because I am not sure if this is norm for them or it was just a fluke because they couldn't handle all these teens that were in town.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay...”
Reviews.Author: prechtc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni in the past by booking directly through the hotel and what a difference it makes to the quality of service. From the moment we checked in we were repeatedly reminded that we were a priceline booking and therefore could not have a room with 2 beds, the kids could not have the handouts, and it took 3 1/2 hours to finally get a roll away which hardly fit in the tiny room we were given. We were very disappointed with the overtly rude service. If they do not want to accomodate third party bookings then they should not make rooms available on third party sites such as priceline. Another inconvenience was due to the fact that 2 of the elevators were not working and we finally had to resort to walking down 8 flights of dirty stairs since we couldn't wait any longer for the one working elevator. Also, we were charged for 3 days of valet parking even though we only stayed 2 nights. We got the extra day of valet refunded and were told they had charged everyone in the hotel for an extra day of valet (on accident). Hmmm.... It isn't likely that we still stay at the Omni again any time soon. We prefer to stay at hotels who treat everyone with respect, offer friendly customer service, and welcome children as well as business guests.

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again...”
Reviews.Author: thejackpotgirl
Reviews.Content: The Omni is very elegant and classy in the lobby areas. Beautiful fresh flowers were abundant and boldly displayed. Upon arrival, the group of valets were very friendly, smiling, attentive and not pretentious in the least. They ended up being a great source of information for us on our trip and were always ready with a smile or a joke. Our room was a king deluxe and though well appointed, was very small. Our shower curtain rod was broken and there was molding missing from the wall beside and behind the toilet that is a sure sign of previous water leakage and repair. The sheets are not a very high thread count and were not the most comfortable. We never dined at our hotel or in our room so I can't comment on that. Drinks at the hotel bar in the lobby (the Severin Bar) were expensive but poured stoutly and service was fantastic. The hotel is fantastically located within walking distance to some of Indianapolis' best dining spots..from top of the line to 3am breakfast joints that serve awesome meals and beers. You can walk through the sky walk to the Circle Centre Mall for great shopping and some more very good dining spots. Absolutely, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “French Kiss NYE Package exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TJMitchell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a New Year’s Eve French Kiss package stay at the Omni Severin and it is safe to say they have the friendliest staff of any hotel we have ever visited. Although attentiveness is often the norm with this caliber of hotel, the Omni Severin was a standout for the overall sincerity of its staff. From management to front desk personnel to wait staff to the valet team, their genuine interest in feedback and the proactive way they sought it out made us feel truly welcome and valued. My wife and I felt so engaged and were given such special consideration, particularly by Massey, the Food and Beverage Manager that we can't wait to come back even if just for the good will that their evident standard of true service inspired. Of course the rooms were clean and comfortable in the four star tradition in terms of décor and crisp, white sheets on a king sized bed and all the toiletries in a sizeable bathroom. And my wife certainly appreciated the walk-in closet complete with robes for two, but the Severin proved to offer a lot more than simply an ideal, pristine space to sleep. When my wife and I arrived for New Year’s Eve dinner in the gorgeously ornate Severin Lobby and Ballroom, we felt even more pampered than we could have anticipated after check in. Worthy of particular notice is the chef, Anthony Armstrong, for his delicious French cuisine that was spotlighted at our NYE celebration. There was a warm sense of community among all the patrons as the emceed event included a short speech by Anthony regarding his sojourn among the French countryside and palate which we all savored heartily in both liquid and solid form. My favorites were the brie pastries with jam, though the entire meal was a formidable treat. Although we all got a small bottle of champagne with the meal, one miniscule suggestion would be to have included at least one complimentary glass of red or white wine with the dinner as it was French themed in the package. We'd of course have been willing to have paid more if added to the package total up front so we wouldn't have to worry about additional transactions later, but this was such a comparatively minor issue compared to the overall experience which was nothing short of spectacular. Before and after the meal, we enjoyed music and an open bar in the ballroom which was an elegant, gorgeous venue for the traditional New Year’s Eve countdown. Although the ambiance was thankfully a far cry from the cramped and noisy club and DJ scene we had already grown tired of, the Severin did add some trendy twists with a mélange of Franco-American movies on widescreen accompanied by a musical guitar/bongo duo playing classic rock fare in offbeat lounge renditions. Occasionally, I’d hear the first half of a soulful acoustic ballad only to realize later we were listening to none other than Jimi Hendrix’s All Along the Watchtower so the hotel entertainment staff deserves kudos for some courageous yet original choices that probably would have struck fear in the hearts of less dynamic hotels. So we counted down to the New Year with more complimentary champagne, more music, good company, party favors, even a garter belt lottery for a free trip to Vegas and by the time 2009 was in its early stages we were ready to head back to our comfy room. The next morning, also included, was a buffet breakfast in the Hot Tuna restaurant. I suppose the Severin could have settled for a standard buffet or continental breakfast with the package, but the spread was replete with fresh fruit, unimaginably light and sweet pastries, bagels, cereal, cheeses, cold cuts, and all the hot breakfast items including personalized omelets which you must absolutely try with the spiced, ground sausage if you are so prone. After being more than sated in the belly, the checkout was so fast and effortless with the pleasant last impressions rivaled only by the first, we started asking ourselves why in the heck we were leaving anyway. Well, we’ll be back soon. They’ve got our email address for the next event. Hmmm, maybe Valentine’s Day?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mharmonLouisville
Reviews.Content: My wife, adult daughter, and I just returned home from a weekend at the Omni Severin in Indianapolis. Great hotel, great staff, and plenty to do in downtown Indianapolis. We weren't there for the Colts football game, but you couldn't help feel the excitement of the fans and the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: moeman1
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the omni for our anniversary. The staff was really nice and went out of there way to help us with dinner reservations and schedule a carriage ride for us. The breakfast buffet at the hot tuna was really great. The room was a little dated with an old school tv, but was very clean. I usually don't get valet parking, but you have to pay $20 to park in a garage. It is worth the extra $5 to have valet park it for you. This was a great hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Omni OK”
Reviews.Author: MsZie
Reviews.Content: Dated facility. Pleasant staff. Nothing to write home about. Barely worth writing a review.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Comfortable Clean Convienient”
Reviews.Author: TraceeT
Reviews.Content: Older, but historic hotel. Very clean rooms and public areas with wonderful large fresh flower arrangements scattered throughout. Decor is a little dated, but well in keeping with the spirit of an elegant older hotel. Moderately large clean very quiet rooms...with comfy bedding. Great staff...especially the omelet chef in the breakfast room who is a really foodie...and excellent at his job. This hotel is attached by a corridor to the large downtown shopping mall, so if you have a shopper in your party, she/he will love it. Great Priceline midweek rate...I'd go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with the Omni”
Reviews.Author: bravebabe31
Reviews.Content: Was so excited about first trip to Indy and first game at the new Lucas Oil Stadium. Booked hotel room through expedia because of the airline package. We were supposed to have a king deluxe room but when we arrived were told that the hotel was booked and since we booked through a third party we had to take the two double bed room. The room we were given was in a private exit way on the 7th floor, it was an exit door with only 2 rooms in this area. The room itself had a great view of the stadium but the one window was broken and there were glass shards in it. My husband wanted to open it but the what was left of the window pane would of fell out. The carpet had came lose from the floor in the middle of the room and it was high enough to trip over. The bathroom was mildew and the tub did not drain well at all. Although we had a great time in the city and the hotel location was incredible very disappointed with the Omni. We are planning a large group trip back to Indy and was hoping to love the Omni to book it but cannot recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Champ
Reviews.Content: You are dowtown in the heart of things, which is a big plus, everything is walking distance. I left this feedback with the Omni. Rooms need to be upgraded, especially, being downtown, and the regular nightly rate. Phenominal Friday ($99) deal is great, however, does'nt excuse room size and comfort. I had reservations for 3 King rooms. 2 rooms were nice in size, however, 1 room was an overally compact space. It could have been alleviated with different furniture and wall mounted TV. All Bathrooms were plain and boring. Valet parking is expensive at $25 nightly. I live in the DC metropolitan area and there are enough places downtown where you could stay and pay less for this service. I definitely felt this impacted the stay, there should be a better rate offered for hotel guests. Honestly, I am a big fan of Kimpton Hotels, because they deliver on bang for buck. I do stay at Omni's occasionally and will continue to do so, however, this particular site needs to work on the "Wow" factor of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Omni's Disney 4th of July!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BelleMalee
Reviews.Content: ***********4th of July!!!!!! *********** Being avid listeners of Radio Disney 98.3 - my kids insisted that we take advantage of the 4th of July Omni/Radio Disney event! In a nutshell: you get a room for $89 for the night (check in at 3.00pm) - we parked for free, parking meters a plenty. Or you can valet at $20+. All kids get a free backpack - and we have three kids; milk and cookies at turndown, a disney media room to play in, a free Radio Disney entertainment/games/event with prizes galore; All guests were invited to the penthouse to view the downtown fireworks - (and you could also view the Ballpark fireworks whilst waiting),oh, and did I mention with complimentary beverages free breakfast for the kids and you didn't have to checkout until 12.00 noon. Now, having travelled the world over, and recently moved to Carmel, it was the best deal and best kept secret in town!!!!! The location is so relaxing. Plenty of dining locations, so close to everything cultural, shopping, movie theatres, the works!!!!!! Thank you Omni - you are a world class hotel! All your staff perform to the highest standards. We love the old world feel of your hotel - YOU HAVE CLASS!!!!!!!!!!! PLEASE repeat this event next year, because we'll be there!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bbroown3333
Reviews.Content: We attended the Indianapolis Tennis Tournament which we attend every year. We have stayed in several downtown hotels during this event in the past. We were skeptical about the Omni since during our last experience there were people shouting in the halls all night. However, we were willing to have an open mind this time. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very professional and courteous. The problem we had was that our shower wouldn't come on. They promised that an engineer would come and fix it, and someone did show up promptly. The bigger problem was that our room for two people was barely large enough for one. We had one queen bed which took up most of the room. We were tripping over each other just moving around in the room. You could hardly open the door unless the bathroom door was closed. You couldn't close the closet door because the hangers would stick out. The vanity was all but nonexistent with little to no room for our things. I requested a king room but because we booked with Priceline they couldn't guarantee that, and we didn't get it. The hotel is at a wonderful location, just a couple of blocks from some fabulous restaurants and it adjoins the Circle Center Mall. The Sunday Brunch, although pricy, was beautiiful and the staff there was courteous and friendly as well. I guess I would be willing to return to the Omni, but I would definitely insist on a larger room. I'm glad we only had to put up with it for one night. Oh, and there were people shouting in the halls all night again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnl10221982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in June. It is a great location within walking distance to everything. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When I explained that my husband was home on leave from his deployment to Iraq, they upgraded our room. We had a beautiful 12th floor room overlooking the city. The room was clean and comfortable. We decided to take advantage of the valet parking. The valet staff was more than willing to make several trips to our car to get things we had forgotten. It was well worth $25. We ordered breakfast in the room during our stay. It was very pricy, but delicious. Because we had our 5 month old son with us, it was very convenient to eat in the room instead of walking around the city until we found something that met our needs. Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel and would visit again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite a 4-Diamond, but Okay and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as part of a four-day conference. The actual conference was in the convention center. If you're booking a conference and plan on having your staff stay at the Severin, please note that it's about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the conference enter. Depending on the time of year, that could be a pretty uncomfortable journey. The hotel is located across from Union Station, right downtown, near the RCA Dome and the new Lucas Oil Stadium. The lobby is very nice, with a reasonable restaurant that serves a good variety of food at the regular high hotel prices. There is a bar located just off the lobby as well. There is also a coffee shop just off the lobby that was a nice selection of items. There is no self parking for this hotel so be prepared to pay $25/night to valet park, or park a block or two away at a public garage. The Indy downtown is great - clean - safe with lots of restaurants, bars, and a large mall. There are a number of major hotels downtown, including Marriott, Hilton and Hyatt. The room was average sized with a comfortable bed, an average bathroom, a desk area, and a couch chair. It includes a ironing board and coffee maker. It does not include a safe. The bathroom was average - not updated, but clean. Little shelf space and a toilet that required two or three flushes to "do its job" despite seemingly sending hundreds of gallons of water swooshing down the pipes. The shower was older, without the new curved rods that give you more head room. There was some mold in the tile. The carpet was a bit worn, had some wrinkles in it, and the chair cushion was a bit torn and faded. The alarm clock was an older model that used colored buttons to indicate buzzer or radio rather than the newer LCD radios. But it worked fine. The hotel is fairly quiet without a lot of street noise and you don't really hear people walking around much. Oddly, there was a recurring whining sound from the elevator mechanism. I say that it was odd because I was located a good 10 or 12 rooms away from the elevator. But I guess the elevator is mounted in a way that it resonates sound across many rooms. Also, the A/C unit performed well, but was very loud, and would turn on with a loud "clunk!". There is wireless Internet for $9.95/day - but if you join the Omni Frequent Points program, it's free - and it's a good, fast connection. The staff is helpful and friendly - no issues there. House cleaning did a good job, but they didn't usually get to the rooms until later in the day. As noted in a previous review, there are two elevators and if you try to head up or down during a busy time, prepare to wait a while for one. The 13th floor is labeled PH for Penthouse, but according to one person staying on that floor, it's no different than other floors. In general, an adequate hotel that's clean, but a bit long in the tooth. It's a solid 3 diamond hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A dream Wedding Reception & package”
Reviews.Author: NYstephB
Reviews.Content: The Omni offered everything we were looking for in a wedding reception and even more. We had a destination wedding and wanted to host a simple reception for family and friends back home. I met with Amanda and she put a beautiful event together for us. The price was very reasonable - and the hotel offered so many small touches to add a very special panache to our celebration. I did not have a lot of time to do any planning or styling of my own for the reception - but that didn't prevent us from having a truly lovely event. The food was amazing. Every guest commented to us after at how impressed they were with the hotel and especially the tasty menu that was offered. I asked for some unique / ethnic options to be added and the chef hit the mark! They also threw in a "romance package" so my husband and I enjoyed the extra pampering of the hotel that extended throughout our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place I've Ever Stayed”
Reviews.Author: realphilbert
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable room I've ever had. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large enough to relax in. The staff is excellent. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- but don't be in a hurry to get to the lobby”
Reviews.Author: lovin2getaway
Reviews.Content: The mini-bar in the room was very expensive ($5.50 for a bottle of water, $2.95 for a Snicker bar, etc.. We left out and went to look for a "regular priced pop machine" only to find out that one didn't exist. Recommend bringing your own drinks to this hotel. Breakfast was full buffet and very tasty.. Easy access to mall via skywalk. Friendly staff. Restaurants around town were hard to get into (1-2 hr wait for each). We ended up eating in the food court of the mall. Walls in the hotel rooms are very thin making it a restless night. I have nothing good to say about the elevators in this hotel. We waited about 10-15 minutes just for the elevator to come to our floor to open. Whenever it stopped and the doors would open, it would be full. We tried to take the stairway but it did not lead down to the lobby but to an outside door that indicates the alarm will sound. If you are trying to leave the hotel, do not wait until the last minute. We were checking out 1/2 hr early and had 6 people in our party coming down from the 4th floor to the lobby to check out and it ended up taking about an hour for us to all get to the lobby (since we had to each ride down separately) because that is all that would fit in the elevator. We then had to wait about 30-40 minutes on our car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SuperChief
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wedding at the Omni. We had a wonderful day and a very nice room...very clean and everything we needed was provided. Our only complaint was the size of the beds. They were only full size beds which were a bit cramped. In our opinion, a hotel such as this one should provide queen size. Had the beds been queen, they would have been much more comfortalble...otherwise, everything was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but nice”
Reviews.Author: summersthree
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were upgraded to a 2 level suite with balcony. Quite nice. The hotel is in need of new furnishings etc..everything was a little worn. The sheets, pillows, and towels were clean and nice, though. The Hotel is in a great spot, lots of stuff to see by foot. Also, it is connected to the Mall and convention center, so it is nice in inclement weather. If the weather is good, and you are going to the RCA Dome or the Convention Center, it is much quicker to just go out the front doors and walk the block to either. The way through the mall is at least three times as long. The mall is quite nice, but there aren't any conveinience stores in the mall. The closest CVS is about 6 blocks away on Illioinis Ave. and is only open until 6:30pm. We needed to go to CVS because my spouse had an allergic reaction to the soap in the hotel. I was dissapointed that the hotel did nothing for us when I told them of the problem. We were in Indy for the FFA convention, and the hotel did not have the huge throngs of kids that many of the other hotels seemed to have, but was still close to all the activities.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Eat-A-Lot
Reviews.Content: We were in Indy visiting old friends & booked the Omni on-line. The rate was pretty good at $199 a night, however 2 days before our stay I noticed a newly available $149 rate. I called the Omni & they kindly changed my reswervation to the $149 rate! On our arrival, we were immediately impressed with the location (in the heart of downtown) & with the lobby. Lots of old world elegance! The staff immediately noticed our 2 young children & promptly brought out an Omni Sensational Kids backpack for them. It was made of cardboard so certainly not durable, but it was full of fun trinkets & the kids felt super special! A table in the lobby had a nice spread of cookies & brownies & hot cider & coffee. The room was more than we expected- pretty spacious, very clean, nicely decorated. The beds were amazingly comfortable! TV reception was not so good on a few channels & there weren't very many channels to choose from, but we wouldn't be in the room much anyway. 2 luxurious robes in the closet were a real treat after showering. Water pressure in the shower was great as was the temp. Could have used more counter space in the bathroom, but we managed. The pool is fairly small & there was no hot tub, but perhaps this is standard in an older building. We have been to too many hotels with freezing pool water & were relieved to find Omni's pool temp was perfect. The fitness facilty looked nice but we had no time to use it. Our $149 rate included coupons for a discount if we had breakfast at the hotel. The 1st morning we went to the small cafe called 40 West. Pretty disappointing...the staff was not helpful, the selections were minimal, the environment was a bit chaoitic. The next morning, we tried the Sunday buffet in the nicer lobby restaurant (don't recall the name). It was fantastic! I even recommend the buffet to our friends that live in Indy. The highlight (for me anyway!) was the turndown service. In addition to turned down beds with chocolates on the pillows, they had turned on the "Relaxation" channel on the TV so calming music filled the room. As if that wasn't enough, they had filled the ice bucket with ice & 2 jugs of milk and there were chocolate chip cookies too. WOW! Plus the left a card on the bed with the forecast for the following day. Our trip was wonderful & much of the credit goes to the Omni. I highly recommend staying at this wonderful hotel. And Indy is a great place to visit, especially with young children. So much to do!

Reviews.Title: “Positives out-weigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: PigskinPete
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel about 6-7 times, all of which were during high school state tournament championships. This is a great hotel that I would recommend to anyone. The location is absolutely perfect for downtown Indy goeers. It is close to everything. The rooms are great. Nice sizes, clean, and they have good views as well. The staff is friendly and gets you checked in and out quickly with no hitches. We've booked through the school every time and have never had any errors. The only negatives to this is the congestion. I think it's hard to get in and out of the enterance because it is small. Also, the other negative is the elevators are pretty slow. The lobby is always crowded, but that is because of the games that are going on at that time. All in all this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: lafguy60
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Omni and it generally was very good with only a couple of minor irritants. First the positives, excellent staff, very clean rooms, vry comfortable beds and terrific location. The irritants were that the valets did not help with the luggage either at arrival or departure, when we arrived there was only one person on duty at the desk. The Omni offers advance check in and in the future we will be using that feature. There were several places in the hallway where room service dishes were left on the floor for over 4 hours. This problem seems to be affecting all hotels that offer room service as I have seen it other times in other hotels and therre are more than a few reviews here on Trip Advisor that mention the same problem. Overall our stay was pleasant and we will stay here again and do recommend the Omni Severin.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: silentbob007
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a nice, one-night getaway after a wedding. The room was booked through Priceline for $53 on a Saturday night. I called in advance to inquire about the room was told that I had been assigned two doubles. I asked about switching to a king or queen and was told that kings were sold out but that I had been reassigned to a queen. Upon arrival (though Circle Center Mall), check-in took a little bit, but when we arrived at the room, it turned out to be a king, which was a little surprising. The room was very pretty and clean. The bed was great with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was a little small, but was well-stocked with nice amenities. The A/C was very efficient, as setting it to cold made the room very cold. It turned out that the night of our stay was also the Sky Concert at White River Park, so we walked across the street to Pan Am Plaza to watch the fireworks. Very great experience. The pool area was the only let down ... it was underground and seemed very small. Parking at the Omni is valet only and is $23/day. Parking at Circle Center Mall (attached to the hotel) is $18. I parked in a garage next to the Hard Rock Cafe (about two blocks away) that was $14/day. In the end, this was a great hotel with extremely friendly staff who always asked how we were doing and if we were enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All the Romance Is at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me for my birthday a couple of years back by doing a whole weekend getaway in our own hometown. Being from Indy you take many of the things downtown for granted without really trying them out. Staying at the Omni was definitely one of the best times we have had. The hotel room was immacualate, and decorated and furnished with all of the amenities you would expect of a downtown historic hotel. This is the oldest hotel in Indy, but it definitely did not feel that way. Everything has been modernized and made to be elegant. The bathrooms, although small by today's standards, were beautifully put together with a granite sink, beautiful knobs and showerhead and super soft towels. There also were two robes in the closet, a large selection of TV channels and movies, and, what makes this Omni great, outstanding service. One day I hope to splurge again and take advantage of the wonderful accomodations and attractions we have in our own hometown, and let the Omni Severin help me forget about the hustle and bustle of everyday life in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: AbeLIncoln,St.Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a company retreat. The entire family went (husband, 2 kids 8, 11). Everyone had a wonderful time. Our room was one of the mini suites. It was on the end with windows on 3 sides of the room and also had a balcony. Beautiful. Was kind of surprised at how small the bathroom was in comparison to the spaciness of the room. We had a king size bed on one end and a living area on the other. A rollaway bed was brought in for no charge, and we didn't even have to request it. Each night we were delighted to find chocolates on our pillows, and milk and choc chip cookies for the kids. Upon check-in the kids were given backpacks complimentary of the Omni full of goodies, both to edible and non-edible. They loved them. The lobby area is beautiful. We did not use the pool. There was even a chocolate fondue set up in the lobby one evening, complimentary for guests, with fruit and other goodies for dipping. My kids were in heaven. We had the brunch on Sunday and it was great. Our stay was just perfect. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: ACoupleOfTravelers
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel throughout. Fast and friendly service from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. I've stayed at many wonderful hotels in downtown Indianapolis and this one is my favorite! Convenient location to shopping, sporting events and restaurants. The room we had was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: bjsteadman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni the weekend of June 16th, 2007 (Formula One race weekend) and really didn't expect the Omni to live up to the glowing reviews. Well, it lived up to those reviews and more!! From the time I pulled my car up to the front doors to have my car valeted (even offered me a cold bottle of water) to the time I left, I experienced nothing but great service and a lovely room. The restaurant, Hot Tuna, was very good and the service wonderful as well. I really look forward to my next stay here. This review comes from someone who has stayed in a lot of luxury hotels and the service in this hotel matched the best of 'em.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, bad parking situatino”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: On a quick weekend trip to Indianapolis to visit relatives, I went on Priceline and was able to get the Omni Severin for $60 / night. This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. I had a great experience each time. The first time I stayed was Mother's Day weekend 2006 and then again this past January. The Mother's Day trip, I had a suite. The Suite was exceptionally comfortable with a full living room, a patio, and views on three sides. The second time I stayed (1/07), they put me in a king room. The room was relaxing and comfortable. The bed was big and soft. I had a great nights sleep. The people working there were the nicest. I looked horrible when I arrived to check in, I had been on the road and visiting with relatives all day. I was exhausted and dirty. They treated me like I was royalty. I truly hold this hotel in very high regard. I do look forward to many returns. :)
